Mrs. N., now 55, was born in the Southern highlands, where as a child she got in contact with Agent Orange during the American war. She was lucky to survive, but she could never give birth to children. Over the years, she survived with the scarce support the Vietnamese government could offer. With a loan from another bank, Mrs. N. opened 2 market stalls for underwear and children's clothes in Do Luong, Nghe An Province, where she moved to live with her husband. She is now asking for a loan of US$200 from TYM Fund to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Mrs. Kanchi T., 29 years old, lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur.  She lives in a single family household with her husband and a son.  Mrs. T. and her husband, Mr. Netra T., both work in their own small hotel and her son is studying in primary school.

She, with the help of her husband, opened the small hotel two years ago.  In their hotel they sell newari food.  Now she seeks $150 to buy goods such as meat, food grains, vegetables and other food materials to improve the standards of her shop.  She is ready to pay back her loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To buy food materials for her shop

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.en: María is 31 years old and has three sons, ages 10, 8 and 7 years-old.  She’s living with her partner who helps with her business.  The couple owns a ‘colmadito,’ a grocery store where they sell basic foodstuffs like rice, sugar, juice, beans, and so on.  María started the business two years ago.  Before, she had been working as saleswoman at someone else´s grocery store.  After putting aside money for a long time, and with her partner’s help, she started her own business.  The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies as they running out.  With the extra income from profits, the couple will be able to continue improving their family’s lives.

loans.use: to supply her business with products such as rice, sugar, floor, vegetable oil to satisfy her client´s demands.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells a variety of foods, but mostly she carries bananas and plantains. She attributes her success to the fact that she is the only large-scale supplier of these products in her area. A few times a week, Ama travels to neighboring villages to purchase bananas and plantains. Then she lugs them back by carrying them into tro-tros (a packed Ghanaian bus, converted from mini-vans). Because of this tedious transportation process, many banana and plantain sellers in the area come to her for their stock.

Ama has three children. The youngest, 14, is in middle school, the second youngest, 19, is studying to become an electrician, and the oldest, 26, is finished school. She hopes to use the profits for their school fees and to build a house for her family. Currently they live in a compound with around 20 people.

Ama is a member of the lending group, Disciples. This group of 19 guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. The members sell various products in Cape Coast. They also offer each other support in their businesses. Support and peer pressure provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To purchase bananas and plantains

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano is 52 years old and his wife, Blásida, is 45. They have six children: hree sons and three daughters. Two of their eldest children work in Argentina and the other four live with them and help them with their work and study.

Mariano’s principle activity is selling artisanal crafts like hammocks and quilts. His wife creates quilts from thread (quilt weaver). It has been more than 30 years since they have been involved in this work, and without knowing another trade, they moved forward giving their children education and sustenance.

Their area of work is the city of Posadas Argentina (a city that can be found in a few hours), where they have a customer base and continue to increase their business thanks to their efforts. Today, they work alongside one of their sons who also is becoming a successful entrepreneur thanks to the support of his parents.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Mariano tiene 52 años de edad y su esposa la señora Blásida 45, tienen seis hijos, tres varones y tres mujeres. Dos de sus hijos mayores se encuentran en Argentina trabajando, y los otros cuatro viven con ellos, les ayuda en el trabajo y estudian.

La actividad principal de don Mariano es la venta ambulante y a crédito de artículos artesanales como hamacas y colchas; y la de su esposa es fabricar colchas de hilo (tejedora de colchas). Hace más de treinta años que se dedican en este trabajo y sin conocer otro labor u oficio, ellos pudieron salir adelante dando alimento y educación a sus hijos.

Su zona de trabajo es la ciudad de Posadas Argentina (ciudad que se encuentra a unas pocas horas), en donde ya tiene clientela formada, y cada vez va aumentando su negocio gracias a su esfuerzo y empeño. Hoy día ya realiza esta actividad junto con uno de sus hijos que también ya va independizándose como un exitoso comerciante gracias al apoyo de sus padres.

loans.use: Purchase of hammocks and bed quilts.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Doña Luzmila is a member of the community bank “Mujeres de Grandes Retos”, and for a living she sells clothing. Her business is located in the town of Huaraz, department of Ancash. With the loan, S/.3,000.00,($1,025) to be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase a dozen girl’s suits , 5 dozen ladies’ jackets, and 2 dozen men’s jackets.

Luzmila is 32 years old, a single mother with two children in elementary school. She needs to increase her income in order to meet family expenses as she is both father and mother in her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luzmila pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres de Grandes Retos, se dedica a la venta de ropas. El negocio está ubicado en la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará una docena de conjuntos para niñas, 5 docenas de casacas para damas, 2 docenas de casacas para caballeros.

Luzmila tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos quienes están en educación primaria. Su ingreso debe permitir sacar adelante a sus hijos porque es padre y madre de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase garments to increase sales.

loans.name: Ruvejda

texts.en: Ruvejda was born in 1956 and she lives in a suburb of Zenica called Nemila. She is married and her husband has a full-time job. He can earn about 1000KM. They have additional incomes from selling pictures that Ruvejda paints. They have three children. By selling pictures, they can earn about 500KM monthly. Ruvejda wants to use this loan to buy material for painting in order to continue her hobby and earn some extra money.

loans.use: Buying material for painting.

loans.name: Chanthyra

texts.en:
Mr. Chanthyra, 25, is single and lives with his widowed mother. He has three brothers and one sister. All of his brothers are employed full-time and his sister weaves silk at home. The family lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Chanthyra is in the business of weaving silk. He learned weaving from his mother and started silk production in 2003. His mother weaves silk at home, too.

Mr. Chanthyra is requesting a loan for the fifth time in the amount of $300 to purchase silk material for weaving. Based on his business success so far, he will have no problem in repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 24-year-old entrepreneur who lives in the town of Kisumu, Kenya. He runs a small kiosk which he opened in 2003. He sells basic, fast-moving commodities such as bread, rice, flour, cooking oil, sugar, eggs, milk, salt and soap. He has applied for a loan of $800 to buy additional stock in bulk to sell to his customers.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena Castillo is 50 years old. She is married and has 4 children who are all independent, but she has three grandchildren in her care. She lives in the Luis Alberto Fujimori neighborhood of Puerto Salaverry, in the department of La Libertad, Peru.

Elena did not go to school, but she has always liked to work hard and get ahead. Since she was very young she has worked in various jobs, and she is currently selling food from her house in the evenings. She also rents rooms to boarders who live in some rooms that she and her husband fixed up for this purpose.

She belongs to the “Las Empresarias Al Exito II” (Business Women Headed for Success II) communal bank. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 and she invested it in the purchase of soft drinks and ingredients for the foods she makes. With this loan of S/. 1,500.00, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will invest it entirely in her food business.

Her greatest dream is to be able to improve her living conditions and thereby be able to make some improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elena Castillo, tiene 50 años de edad. Esta casada y tiene 04 hijos, los cuales son independientes, pero tiene 03 nietos pequeños a su cuidado. Ella vive en el P.J Luis Alberto Fujimori, en el Puerto Salaverry, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La señora Elena, no estudió pero siempre le gustó progresar, así es que desde muy joven se dedicó a diferentes actividades, actualmente vende comida en su casa por las noches, da pensión a algunos inquilinos que viven en algunos ambientes que ella y su esposo acondicionaron para alquilarlos. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Empresarias Al Éxito II ” Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.oo y lo invirtió en la compra gaseosas y víveres para la elaboración de los menús. El préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que cancelará en 6 meses lo invertirá completamente en su pequeño negocio de comida Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y así poder darle algunos acabados a su casa.

loans.use: She will buy more ingredients for the preparation of the foods she makes for sale

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs.Chan S. I., age 39, is a mother of three children and lives with her husband on the outskirts of Phnom Penh. One of her children is a waiter, another a  student, and one is too young to attend school.  Mrs. Chan is a garment worker earning, on average, $2.50 each day, while her husband, Srun Vuthy, works with his son in a nearby restaurant as a waiter. To achieve additional income, this couple is requesting a $500 loan to purchase cows to breed. In the future, the family also hopes to raise poultry.

loans.use: To purchase cows to breed for additional profit.

loans.name: Norma Nuehmi

texts.es:
Norma is divorced and has to support her two small children, aged 10 and 6, practically alone. She began to sew clothing for people she knew since she has been a skilled seamstress since she was 16 years old. Now she has taken advantage of her abilities and is making school uniforms. Thanks to this business, she has been able to move her family ahead.

She needs a loan of $250, which she will repay in 3 months, to buy a sewing machine. The machine will allow her to fulfill her objectives and increase her earnings. With your help Norma will grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

.Norma es divorciada y tiene que mantener a sus 2 pequeños de 10 y 6 años, prácticamente sola. Comenzó a coser ropa solo a sus conocidos ya que lla cunta con esta habilidad desde hace 16 años, pero en la actualidad le ha sacado provecho a esto y hace uniformes escolares y gracias a esto ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar una maquina para poder cumplir con sus objetivos y de esta manera obtener una mayor ganancia. con tu ayuda Norma hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Akiba's Tusongembele Group

texts.en:
Akiba, 42, is married with one 18-year-old child. She sells bedsheets and fish and works from 7AM to 5PM. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Akiba is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of bedsheets and fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Ndeure, who has a business dealing with tailoring and juice sales.

loans.use: To buy more bedsheet and fish for resale.

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!

This is 24-year-old Happiness Cholobi from Dar Es Salaam. She is married with 2 children, between the ages of 5 years and 8 years. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependents who are orphans. Happiness has been running a shoe business since 2007. She buys shoes at wholesale and sells them to retail customers. Her business is doing well. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Happiness currently earns a monthly profit of about $50 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $275 in order to buy additional shoes from wholesalers and sell them to the people in the street. In the future, she plans to establish a permanent place for her business.

Happiness thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional shoes from wholesaler and  sell them to the people in street.

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
Con casi 3 años D. puesto su local, la señora Norma, D. 52 años, expenD. ahí menúes y cervezas para sus comensales pero, inclusive con estos 2 ingresos, le es insuficiente para tamaña familia: su esposo, su hija, cuñado y 2 nietas, que son su fuerza, por lo que también recurre a una actividad mensual: vender pachamancas.

Ningún esfuerzo es digno D. sus nietas, D. su familia, por lo que la señora Norma sueña con terminar D. implementar el ambiente del local, en su propia casa, así como también hacerse D. más insumos para la preparación D. menúes y compra D. cervezas, para lo cual necesita D. 700 soles D. préstamo en aras D. poder brindarle una mejor calidad D. vida a su familia.
texts.en:
With almost 3 years in the same location, Señora Norma, 52, sells set-menu meals and beer to her clients, but these two incomes together are insufficient for the size of her family: her husband, daughter, brother-in-law and 2 nieces are her strength. Señora Norma dreams of completing the decoration of her business place as well as her own home, plus buying meal ingredients and beers, for which she needs this loan of $250, in order to proviD. her family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete her business place where she sells meals and beer, plus purchasing meal ingredients and beers

loans.name: Guzal

texts.en:
Guzal H. is a brave woman who has done agricultural work in far-off fields since she was a child. She takes her cattle and sheep out to pasture every day. She enjoys her daily labor, and once in 2-3 months on weekends, she travels to the markets in her area to sell her animals in order to give daily sustenance to the members of her household. She is married and the mother of 4 children, and she continues working with the great responsibility which she bears. 
Her dream is to increase the amount of livestock that she cares for. In order to continue realizing part of this dream, Guzal is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) for the term of 12 months to invest in the purchase of a cow. You can help this brave woman to continue her work.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort S. is 35 years old. She is a widow and has three children. Two of her kids are still in school, one has not started school. She owns and operates grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, pastries which she prepares by herself, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits etc. in her neighborhood. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. S. belongs to the Trust group called Ephesians Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water and boxes of biscuit etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase seed, plant cuttings, manure, and fuel oil.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mr. Chanthorn L., 32, and his wife, Mrs. Sopheap Nhong, 31, were married in 1997 and have four sons. Two of their sons attend school and the other two sons are still young. The family lives in a small village aL. National Road Number Five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chanthorn has been driving a motor taxi for twelve years. His wife has been selling lotus flowers since she was married. She buys them from the village where she lives for resale at the market in Phnom Penh. The couple sells rice as well. Chanthorn is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase rice for resale.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia is 45-years old and she is married with four children. Antonia sells foodstuffs and dried fish in her house. She is optimistic about the continuous growth of her business and improving the well being of her family.  Antonia is requesting a loan to purchase more foodstuffs and dried fish so she can increase the number of customers she serves. She says thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Dora Herlinda,

texts.es:
Desde hace un año, Dora se encarga de atender en su negocio de venta de salchipapas y frituras en la puerta de su casa. No obstante, debido a que hay temporadas en la que no hay mucha salida en este negocio, ella también ofrece el servicio de limpieza y lavado de ropa en casas particulares. Fue así como comenzó a trabajar hace cuatro años.

Antes de dedicarse al negocio de comida, ella vendía ropa. Lo compraba a un precio cómodo y lo revendía a un precio mayor a clientes.

A sus treinta y tres años, ella esta a cargo de su único hijo de once años, del cuidado de su mamá y de un hermano con retraso mental. Es con estas grandes responsabilidades que ella sueña con poder conseguir un local más grande para su negocio de comidas.
texts.en:
For a year, Dora has worked out of her home, running a business selling hotdogs and other snacks. However, because there are seasons in which there isn't a lot of business, she also offers a cleaning and laundry service in the homes of clients. It was in this way that she started working four years ago.

Before dedicating herself to her hotdog stand, she sold clothes. She bought clothing at a reasonable price and resold it at a profit to her customers.

At thirty three years old, she is responsible of her only child, eleven years old, and of the care of her mother and a brother with developmental disabilities. With these enormous responsibilities, she dreams of being able to find a bigger space to house her business selling food.


Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en: Mrs. Maridel A. is 54 years old and married to Bernard, a fisherman. They have 9 children and 6 of them are married. Their source of income relies on her husband's fishing and her fish vending. Mrs. A. has been a Co-op member since 2004. She is good and religiously pays her obligations to the cooperative. She is borrowing the amount of PHP 20,000 for the acquisition of a new set of fishing nets. The loan will help her with additional income generation and with sustaining the daily needs of the family.

loans.use: To buy a new set of fishing neta

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en:
Ebenezer B. is 39 years old. He is married and a father with two kids: one is currently in school and the newborn baby is still being breastfed.

Ebenezer is a dealer and supplier of phone cards and phone chips. He also provides repairs and services for his customers. He says the sale of phone credits has become a very lucrative business in Ghana because almost every Ghanaian desires to possess a mobile phone and always recharges his or her phone credit. He buys his supplies from agents at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices.

He requests this loan in order to enable him to increase his stock of mobile phone credits. He hopes the loan will enable him to increase his savings as well as to expand his shop to include the sale of mobile phones. He belongs to the village bank called ‘Yesu Abusua,’ which literally means 'God’s family.'

loans.use: To increase his stock of mobile-phone credits and unit transfer.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma N. manages a small sari-sari store. She is 36 years old and has 3 children. She wants to have bigger store some day. She works very hard to be able to sustain her business and provide for the needs of her family. Aside from having a store, her family grows rice which they use to buy their other needs.

She is asking for a loan of 8,000 Philippine Pesos from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store. The loan will also help her get better income for her family.

CEVI aims to help small businesses grow. They provide not just credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
El señor Juan José C. tiene la edad de 65 años, habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, en la comunidad de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa, ellos tiene tres hijos, todos mayores de edad y casados, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, el desde hace treinta y un
Años se dedica a la agricultura, con sus propios esfuerzos inicio esta activad, los planes hacia un futuro es su cultivo es poder comprar mas terreno y poder heredar a sus hijos. Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar los fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para aplicar al cultivo y poder obtener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Jose C. is 65 years old, lives with his wife in the Juan Ramon Padilla area of the Ticuantepe community. They have three children, all adults and married. He wishes to improve the living conditions of his family. He has been a farmer for the last thirty one years. He started this activity on his own. He wants to be able to buy more land and leave the farm for his children. The loan proceeds will buy more fertilizer and supplies for his fields and will make him able to improve his production.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and fertilizers needed for the crops.

loans.name: Sika

texts.fr: Sika A. est une jeune femme de 29 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’une pharmacie à Lomé. Sika tient ce commerce depuis 3 ans. Avec ce crédit, Sika souhaite approvisionner son magasin afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de la clientèle sans cesse croissante.
texts.en:
Sika A. is a young woman, 29 years old, married, and the mother of two. She is the owner of a pharmacy in Lomé. Sika has had this business for three years. With this loan, she would like to stock her store in order to respond better to her ever-growing number of customers

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her pharmacy

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 33 years old. She is married, and the mother of four children. Currently all her children are in school in the community where they live. Grace works very hard to support her dear husband in taking care of the family. She trades in bulk vegetables like onions, and she started this business two years ago. Most times Grace treks to the Northern Region of Ghana to purchase her stock. She wanted to add other foodstuff to her stock, as her customers frequently ask for those goods. She is now requesting a loan to buy quantities of onions and other goods. This she believes will provide her with the resources for taking care of the family.

loans.use: To buy quantities of onions to retail

loans.name: Emomali

texts.ru: Эмомали Саидов проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 45 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Эмомали более 25 лет занимается услугой такси по маршруту Хамадони-Душанбе-Хамадони. Кредит просит для отремонтирования своей автомашины. В дальнейшем он сможет предоставлять качественную услугу.
texts.en:
Emomali S. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 45 years old, married and has five children. For more than 25 years, Emomali has engaged in providing taxi services along the route Hamadoni-Dushanbe-Hamadoni. The loan request is for repairs to his vehicle. In the long term, he will be able to offer higher quality service.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Мухаббат

texts.en: Солиева М 1962 года рождения. Замужем имеет четверых детей. У нее  дома есть вязальная машина. Она на дому вяжет разные детские костюмчики, джемпера, носки. Еще у Солиевой есть дополнительный доход. Ее муж и сын имеют продуктовый магазин в 34 микрорайоне. Она планирует закупить шерстяные нитки и благодарна кредиторам.

loans.use: На закупку шерстяных ниток

loans.name: Triangle Solidarity Group

texts.es: El grupo Solidario llamado El Triangulo está conformado por Tamara Patricia L. T., Paulita Mercedes Rojas T. Pérez y Lucia T. Pérez. A pesar de las diversas actividades económica que ellas tienen como es venta de cosméticos, venta de comida y pulpería. Todas tienen  el mismo objetivo de salir adelante porque sus negocios les han propiciado los estudios necesarios a sus hijos. A pesar de los desafíos que han enfrentado juntas ya que no poseen el capital suficiente, pero con el paso del tiempo han aprendido a manejar muy bien sus negocios. El financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos que corresponden a cada una de sus actividades económicas y ampliar su producción con fin de mejorar sus ingresos y brindarles mejoras económicas a su hogar.
texts.en:
The Triangle solidarity group is made up of Tamara Patricia L. T., Paulita Mercedes Rojas T. Pérez, and Lucia T. Pérez. Despite the range of activities that the women engage in, from selling cosmetics, selling food, and owning a small corner shop, all of them have the same objective of moving forward, especially because their businesses have allowed them to provide schooling for their children. In spite of the challenges that they have encountered due to insufficient capital, with time they have learned how to manage their businesses better. The loan that they request is for the purchase of products that correspond to each of their businesses in order to increase their production and income and bring an improved economic state to their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase materials/products for their businesses

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna F. is already 55 years old. She is married to Pedro, and they are living in the village of Calao East, Santiago City. She is engaged in a dressmaking business, and she also does clothing repairs. Some of the things she makes are school uniforms, sport uniforms, women's dresses, and pants for men. She wants to improve the quality of her finished product. And for this she needs to replace her old sewing machine. For this reason, Myrna is requesting to borrow a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to 4,000 PHP, to use as additional capital for the maintenance of her dressmaking business. 

Myrna is already getting old, and hopes to retire from dressmaking; however, life is becoming difficult, and thus she continues running the business no matter how tiring it is. She is thankful that her husband is always on her side supporting her every time she needs help. According to her, they must maintain the business for the welfare of their children. Her eldest child, Arlene, is already 23 years old, and Anthony, who is a college student, is 19 years old.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Argentina Azucena

texts.es: La señora  Argentina Azucena de 46 años  de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, madre soltera de 6 hijos, tres mayores trabajan y son independientes y tres están a su cargo y que estudian para tener un vida social mejor, su negocio es el acarreo  en un carretón con caballos, al día hace de 9 a 12 viajes, de diferentes viajes como acarreo de bloques, verduras, frutas, madera a si como votar basura todo que le genere ingresos, lleva siete años es este negocio, con este préstamo es su noveno ciclo en Afodenic, el cual invertirá en compra de caballo chuscarro, para domesticarlo y engordarlo y venderlo a mejor precio. Sus planes es poder ampliar su acarreo con otra jabalina y que generen mejores ganancias.

loans.use: Compra de caballo chucarro para reforzar su trabajo y vender

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino is 43 years old and lives with his partner Marcelina, who is 40. They have three children, who are ages 17, 19, and 20. Marcelino operates a grocery store from his house, but has to work away from the home as well in order to meet the needs of his family. The grocery store is therefore attended to by a partner, while Marcelino and his children go out and sell over-the-counter medicines.

Marcelino is very proud of his family’s efforts. They have managed to obtain many benefits for his home such as a TV, a refrigerator, sound equipment, and other appliances. With this loan he wants to purchase goods such as flour, rice, noodles, sugar, bread, and the like.

loans.use: To buy goods such as flour, rice, noodles, sugar, bread, and the like.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion A. is from the village of San Roque. He is 40 years old. Concepcion is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Concepcion owns & operates a carpentry business in the services sector operating a service-based business. His main source of income from the business comes primarily from providing carpentry services to local community members. Concepcion has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2006, Concepcion joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Concepcion has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Concepcion from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About PMPC:  Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve his carpentry business

loans.name: Janela

texts.en: Janela B. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 39 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Janela owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Janela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Janela is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou B. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin. She is 20 years old. Analou is single. To make a living, Analou owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Analou has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Analou is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Laskmi

texts.es:
Nuestra socia LASKMI tiene 34 años, es conviviente, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” de la Asociación Arariwa.      
 
La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la confección de chompas artesanalmente. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Todos los meses confecciona chompas según los pedidos lo que los clientes deseen, hay veces que tiene que invertir hasta mucho dinero en confeccionar, ya tiene sus clientes fijos que son muy responsables y para esta época del año es cuando más vende. Nuestra socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más lana para confeccionar más chompas. 
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Laskmi is 34 years old, lives with her partner, and is a native of the city of Cusco. She belongs to the Patron Santiago de Santiago Community Bank, a part of the Arariwa Association. As well as taking care of household duties, Laskmi knits traditional sweaters. She has been doing this for several years and the business has done well thanks to her hard work. Every month she makes sweaters in response to the orders placed by her customers. Sometimes she has to invest a lot of money in her business since she has regular customers, and also this is the time of year when she sells the most items. Laskmi is hardworking, enterprising, and is supporting her family well. She requires a loan to buy more wool for the sweaters. She is grateful for the opportunity to obtain a loan and promises to make repayments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wool for more sweaters

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn is 34 years old and has been married to her husband, Noel, since 2003. She has two kids with him. Her oldest child is now fifteen years old and goes to school. She is involved in rice farming and has been doing that since she got married. She and her husband work hard at the farm to earn an income as well as for their childrens future. She has also sought the help of MFIs in the Philippines and was able to become a member of CEVI. She feels blessed for having gained access to its financial services. She is now applying for a loan of Php15, 000. She will use this loan to finance her farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Maricel Manalang Group

texts.en: Maricel M. is from the village of Antonino, Alicia, Isabela. She is 40 years old. She is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Maricel is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP every week. In 2007, Maricel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her fifth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita D. is a 68-year-old married woman who lives in Prk. Luyang Brgy Guiljungan, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling herbal products in her community, running a pig-fattening operation, and as a charcoal retailer.

Amelita’s husband Rogelio helps also in running the businesses. Together they have 11 children between 29 to 48 years old. Nine of her children already have families, and the remaining two work and help their parents in household needs. They sometimes help in the selling of herbal products.

Amelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1990 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family, earning an average monthly income of Php 10,000 from her business activities.

Amelita is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 19,000 was used to fund operations of her herbal products dealership, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 15th loan, in the amount of Php 12,000, which she intends to use to purchase additional inventory for her herbal products business. Amelita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Fuente De Bendiciion Group

texts.en:
Reina is the coordinator of her group 'Fuente D. Bendicion' (Source of Blessing), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, a poor, agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner.

Reina is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing merchandise to sell including fish and shrimp. She will use the profits to invest in her future by saving towards going to university after she finishes her high school courses and inves in her home by purchasing a plot of land on which to construct her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: buying fish and shrimp to sell

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Adela es soltera y tiene 39 años, Adela vive en la comunidad de Alpachaca que se encuentra a 3 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Adela se dedica a la compra y venta de quesos, tiene ganado vacuno que produce leche para la producción de quesos y también compra de otros productores, sus productos los comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Adela necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de queso y leche.
El sueño de Adela son construir su casa de material noble.
texts.en:
Adela is a member of the Azucenas Communal Bank.

Adela is a 39-year-old single woman who lives in the Alpachaca community, located some 3 hours away from the city of Ayacucho. She buys and sells cheese for a living. She owns some cows, which produce the milk she uses to make cheese. She also buys other products, which she then sells in the city of Ayacucho.

Adela needs a 3,000 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing cheese and milk. She dreams of building her own sturdy house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese and milk

loans.name: Justa Francisca

texts.es: La señora Justa Francisca, tiene 52 años. La señora Justa tiene una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dio inicio a este negocio con esfuerzos propios hace 10 años, el cual surgió para buscar fuentes alternativas de ingresos, ya que había enfermado y necesitaba permanecer más tiempo en su casa. Con una buena administración le ha ido bien en su negocio al mismo tiempo ayuda a su esposo con su enfermedad que trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de inventarios, principalmente desea invertir en compra de granos básicos, que son los que más busca la gente en su venta. Su sueño en el futuro siempre ha sido llegar a tener un mini súper, ya que vive en un barrio con bastante demanda de productos básicos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Justa Francisca is 52 years old. Mrs. Justa has a general store located in her home. She started this business, through her own efforts, 10 years ago due to the need to have an alternative source of income. Her husband had become ill and she needed to spend more time in her house. With good management, her business has done well. She helps her husband with his illness and works, helping to cover the expenses of the home. The loan will be used to purchase more inventory, she mainly wants to invest in the purchase of basic grains, which are what her customers look for the most. Her dreams for the future have always been of having a mini market since she lives in a neighborhood with a good demand for basic products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena M. is from the village of Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Nena is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Nena owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fruit in the local community. Nena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Nena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
49-year-old Nida raises pigs for a living and also plants corn on her land. She is married with three children, her eldest being age twenty-five.

Nida said that she needs additional capital for her pigs and corn farm. She applied to CEVI and asked to loan Php 15,000 which she will use it to buy pig feed, corn seed and fertilizer. She is hopeful that this loan will help her earn more.

loans.use: To buy pig feed, corn seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Mrs. Lolita S. is from the village of Fuentes Subdivision of Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, married, and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Lolita runs a sari-sari store. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Lolita joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used as capital for her existing sari-sari store business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions, especially in meeting their basic needs and saving for future use and possible business expansion.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her existing sari-sari store business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita M. is from the village of Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is 59 years old. Anita is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a hog fattening business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Anita has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Anita is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Anita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu K. started trading in phone accessories in the township of Makeni with a very small amount of capital, which he accessed from the sale of his father's land. He is married with four kids, all of whom are attending school. His spouse is a secondary school leaver (graduate) and now a trader. 

Saidu K. has been in business for 25 years now.  He is seeking a loan to purchase more stock and generate more income. He hopes, however, to use the proceeds from the loan to educate his children and send them abroad.

loans.use: To buy phone accessories

loans.name: Jovielyn

texts.en:
Jovielyn U. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 31 years old, married and has a child aged five. She raises pigs for fattening and sale. She also has some chickens. Aside from that, she manages a sari-sari store where she sells food and basic daily necessities. She is a hard-working mother aiming to save for her child's future.

In January 2010, Jovielyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovielyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jovielyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jovielyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor Maria S. M. tiene 36 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar en el Recinto Delicia.  Tiene 1 hijo, Alejandra (2). 

Flor es una socia de la ventanilla rural El Progreso La Delicia Recinto que pertenece a la Parroquia San José del Tambo, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a sembrar cacao y maíz.

Flor se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y soya.  Realiza sus compras cada mes de los productos y de los insumos para la siembra en los Agro servicios de AGRIPAD y vende los productos en el Mercado de Chillanes.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos de maíz y soya. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener mejor ingreso económico para superarse en la vida. El desafío que enfrentamos es el tiempo y la falta de recursos económicos.

Le gusta trabajar en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Flor Maria is 36 years old. She is single and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the Bolívar province of Recinto Delicia. She has a 2 year old daughter, Alejandra. Flor is a member of the community bank "El Progreso La Delicia Recinto" which belongs to the parish San José del Tambo. This group has 19 members, and the community works growing chocolate and corn. Flor is a farmer who grows corn and soy. Each month, she buys the products and inputs for sowing the crops at the agricultural suppliers AGRIPAD and sells her products in the market at Chillanes. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies of corn and soy beans. She thinks that this loan is an opportunity for her to move her business forward. Her dream is to have greater income so that she can better herself. The challenges that face us are time and the lack of economic resources. She likes working in agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of corn and soy beans

loans.name: Marie Claudine

texts.en:
Marie Claudine is 32 years old and married with two children, one of whom is four years old and attending school, while the other is only 6 months old. She and her husband, a veterinarian, both work hard to improve their family's standard of living.

Marie Claudine sells fertilizers for a variety of plants including wheat, carrots, and some fruits. She has been in this business for over five years and plans to use this loan to expand the types of fertilizers she carries, including fertilizers for cabbage. She also plans to buy seeds and insecticides to sell to local farmers. The seeds Marie Claudine will purchase are sealed in tin cans and last for a long time. With the profits she hopes to purchase a cow to ensure a constant supply of milk for her family, and eventually she anticipates buying a house so she no longer has to rent.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides to sell

loans.name: Anyae

texts.en: Anyae J. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut paste at the market and is requesting a loan to also stock onions, tomatoes and cooking oil to sell.  Anyae is 31 years-old and is married with a husband that is a peasant. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: To stock onions, tomatoes and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Señor De Acoria Group

texts.es:
La comunidad D. Acoria pertenece al distrito D. Acoria ubicado en el departamento D. Huancavelica (el más pobre del Perú), ubicada a una altitud D. 2880 metros, las principales actividades son la agricultura, ganadería y el comercio. Al distrito se llega por vía férrea Huancayo – Huancavelica.
Olga es socia del Bancomunal, tiene 3 hijos D. 19, 11 y 4 años, su negocio es una tienda donD. venD. abarrotes y verduras desD. hace 10 años, en los últimos años ha implementado la venta comida y ahora quiere complementar la venta D. café y jugos, cada día implementa mas su negocio para que crezca. Dos D. sus hijos estudian y el tercero es pequeño por tanto no le ayudan mucho en el negocio, pero gracias a los préstamos que recibe ha podido ir creciendo e invirtiendo más en su negocio. Olga solicita un préstamo D. 1000 soles para la compra D. productos para su negocio y una licuo-extractora para la venta D. jugos.
El sueño D. Olga es crecer con el negocio para mantener a sus hijos, que sigan estudiando hasta el nivel superior. La motivación D. Olga son sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Acoria community is part of the Acoria district, located in the Huancavelica department (the poorest in Peru). It's located at an elevation of 2880 meters and its mainstays are farming, livestock, and business. The Huancayo – Huancavelica railroad runs to the district. Olga is an associate of Bancomunal. She has three children, ages 19, 11, and 4. She has been running a small grocery and vegetable store for the past 10 years and has added prepared food to her sales in recent years, she now wants to complement it with coffee and juices. Each day she adds something to her business in order to make it grow. Two of her children attend school and the third one is very young. They don't help her with her business very much, but thanks to the loans she's gotten, she's been able to grow and invest more into her business. Olga is asking for a 1,000 PEN loan in order to buy products for her business, and also a juicer so that she can sell juices. Her dream is to grow with her business so that she can support her children so that they will continue with their studies to the highest achievement. Olga is motivated by her children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory and a juicer

loans.name: Gemima

texts.en:
Gemima S. is from the village of Usocan. She is 71 years old. Gemima is married and has three adult children. Gemima owns and operates a farm. The main source of income for the business comes from cultivating fruit trees & harvesting their fruit for sale. Gemima has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2000, Gemima joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Gemima has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 15,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to expand the business. Gemima is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will also be used to expand the business. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Gemima from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding the business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty N. is currently in the business of selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell. Betty is 25 years old and is married. Her husband is a tax collector. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hilda Ceferina

texts.es: Hilda se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Hace más de 32 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ha sido de gran provecho esta oportunidad que tuvo al trabajar con créditos. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para el sostenimiento de su familia, por lo que tiene una gran variedad de clientes que le solicitan sus frutas muy frescas. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de inventario pues es necesario para mantener a sus clientes. En el futuro quiere mejorar su espacio en donde coloca los diferentes productos que ofrece y llamar la atención de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hilda sells fruits and vegetables.  She’s been in this business for over 32 years.  Being able to have the opportunity to work with these loans has been of great use to her.

The business if very helpful for her family’s support.  She has a wide variety of customers who request her very fresh fruit.

The reason for the loan is to buy more stock inventory to retain her customers.

In the future she’d like to improve the space where she displays her products and attract her customers’ attention.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to stock her business.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is the wife of M. R. and resides in a city named Depalpur in Paksitan. Shahnaz is a 45-year-old caring lady. She carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and takes care of her children well.  

Among her five children are three daughters and two sons. Only her eldest son managed to get an education till 5th class. Shahnaz and her husband are unable to provide education to her children due to financial constraints. 

Her husband is a private entrepreneur and is involved in a movie-making business. He provides his services for different parties like birthdays, marriage ceremonies, etc. He has been in this business for over five years and has a good reputation due to his quality of work. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s movie-making business. With the loan, he will buy a digital movie camera which will help him in producing quality work for his customers. Shahnaz is hopeful that through this investment, her husband’s business will get a new shape and enable him to get good profits on each booking. 

Shahnaz is confident that she will enroll her younger children in school with the help of the loan's profit.

loans.use: To buy a digital movie camera for a movie-making business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty S. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Betty is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Betty owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from purchasing and selling a variety of vegetables for sale.  Betty has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Betty joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Betty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  Betty is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Betty from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine I. of Talibon, Bohol has a sari-sari and bakery store that she runs with her husband. Funding from CEVI would allow them to expand their inventory.

They would also use the money to buy ingredients like milk, flour and sugar for their bakery. This would make them more competitive and increase their income.

They have three children. The additional income would help provide for the family's daily needs and enable them to save money for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell and ingredients for the bakery

loans.name: Gbampo Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Gbampo” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to invest in their respective businesses. In this way, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Sonie K..  Sonie is aged forty; she was born in Makeni city where she is currently residing together with her husband and five children. Her husband is a retired soldier and three of her children are attending secondary school. For five years now, Sonie has been selling cooked rice. With this loan, she will buy cooking ingredients such as palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, fish, salt, Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), firewood, etc., wholesale.

loans.use: Buy cooking ingredients such as palm oil, rice, fish, salt, Maggi cubes, firewood, etc., wholesale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose D. is currently in the business of selling onions, sugar, tomatoes, beans, rice, and passion fruits, and is requesting a loan to stock more of these items to sell. Rose is 23 years old and is married to a carpenter. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy domestic animals like chickens, goats, and sheep, to raise at home.

loans.use: To stock more onions, tomatoes, rice, passion fruits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Kareem from Marka- Amman is 31 years old, a married man and the father of one child. He is a hard worker and a dedicated man who has a car washing shop.  He is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to purchase a new machine for his shop.

Kareem is planning for the future to buy new machines managed by computer ,he also wish to improve his family's quality of life .

loans.use: to purchase a new machine for his shop

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Adama. She is married and has three children, ages 6, 8 and 12. In 2000, Adama established her women's bags business. She began her business because she inherited it from her mother. Before, she had helped her mother with the business for many years. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 300,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more used bags. Adama hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 450,000. In the future, Adama plans to educate her children on to the university level. Adama sells quality stock to customers and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more used bags

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 34 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,a la vez la socia es docente del nivel primario del colegio nacional de Urubamba, la socia es una persona bien alegre y optimista y de esta forma la socia saca  a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de alimento como pasto,maíz entre otros mas para a sus animales y también para la compra de mas animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the "SEÑOR PASION” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Luz Marina is 34 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She is also an elementary school teacher and teaches at the 'Colegio Nacional de Urubamba'.  She is a very happy and optimistic person and, through her work, she gets her family ahead in life.

Luz Marina is requesting a loan to buy feed, such as fodder, corn, etc., for her animals.  She will also buy more animals.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy feed, such as fodder, corn, etc., for her animals and to buy more animals.

loans.name: Jessika K.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the R.C Hanga II Primary School in Kenema city. Teachers of this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of SLL 6,500,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will each be able to improve their standard of living. 

Fifty-five year old Jessika K. K. is the leader of this group of teachers. Jessika was born in Kailahun, she is married and has 2 children who are in college. Jessika is a teacher and a businesswoman. She has been in the teaching profession for 35 years now. Jessika is going to use her share of this loan to invest in her business. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish some certain tasks that they would otherwise have not been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Rosiveth Arely

texts.es:
Rosiveth es una joven D. 25 años, casada, vive con su esposo René, ellos residen en Perquin departamento D. Morazán, ella administra una zapatería, este negocio lo tiene desD. hace un año, lo atienD. D. lunes a viernes, el fin D. semana lo dedica a sus estudios universitarios. Ella por el momento necesita invertir en mercadería para esto solicita un préstamo y con estos fondos comprar específicamente zapatos para niños, femeninos y masculinos.
Esta inversión le ayudara a proveer a los clientes una mayor variedad en estilos, colores y marcas D. calzado, teniendo la capacidad para atender la demanda. Los objetivos D. Rosiveth son mejorar la vivienda, terminar sus estudios en derecho, ser en un futuro notario, ejercer su profesión, dar empleo a personas que lo necesitan y tener sus hijos.
texts.en: Rosiveth is 25 years old and married. She lives with her husband, René. They live in Perquín, in the department of Morazán. She runs a shoe store, which is a business she has had for one year. Her store is open Monday through Friday. She dedicates her weekends to her university studies. She needs to purchase inventory, and this is why she is requesting a loan. Specifically, she will buy children’s shoes, for both girls and boys. This investment will help her to proviD. a greater variety of styles, colors, and brands to her customers, which will help her meet demand. Rosiveth’s goals are to improve her house, to finish her law studies, to be a notary in the future, to work in her field, to be an example to others, and to have children.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Las Carmelitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama las Carmelitas y se ubica en la localidad de Julián Grajales, Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México.

    La señora Deonila Gutiérrez M., es viuda y tuvo cuatro hijos tres varones y una mujer, quienes tres ya están casados y Rosa Aurelia de diesi siete años  quien a  un está a su responsabilidad.

    Ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes, como son: masa, carne, chile ancho, hoja de guineo, pasas, entre otros, para la elaboración de tamales, en donde lleva once años de experiencia y comenta que le va bien  ya que con ellos a estado sacando adelante a su familia.

     Para poner esta actividad lo decidió sola ya que para sacar adelante a sus hijos tenía que emprender un trabajo de lo que le diera resultado y obtuviera un buen ingreso para sostenerse en la vida y gracias adiós lo está logrando.

     Con la ganancia que va obteniendo se apoya para apoyar a su hija que está estudiando y quiere que tenga lo más necesario  para su educación, de eso mismo obtiene para comprar más ingredientes y así poder seguir trabajando.
 
     Su más  grande deseo es que logre salir adelante para darle lo mejor  a su hija y  así sin ningún pretexto deje de echarle ganas en seguir estudiando.

     En el grupo se integro por una invitación que le hizo la señora María del Carmen  quien es su vecina a que solicitaran un préstamo para apoyarse y trabajar alguna actividad en la que se apoyaran.

     Las integrantes del grupo son tres y son las siguientes:

     Deonila Gutiérrez M.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales y  luego venderlo en la misma comunidad.

     Carmela Hernández Sánchez: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de puertas, ventanas, entre otros para posteriormente venderlo.

      María del Carmen N. G.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de Panes.
texts.en:
The group is called “Las Carmelitas”, and they are located in the locality of Julián Grajales in Chiapas, México.  Deonila Gutiérrez M. is a widow and has four children, three boys and a girl, of whom three are now married.  Her youngest, Rosa Aurelia, is seventeen years old and still dependent on her.  She will invest the loan into the purchase of ingredients such as: dough, meat, chilies, banana leaves, raisins, and other items for making tamales.  She has eleven years of experience in this business, and tells us that things are going well as it allows her to help her family get ahead.

She made the decision to start this business on her own since, in order to support her children, she had to undertake a type of work that would produce results and generate income. 

With the earnings, she helps her daughter continue her education and reinvests a portion back into the business, purchasing ingredients so she can keep working.  Her greatest wish is to get ahead so she can offer her daughter a higher standard of living, and so there are no excuses for her to quit school.

She joined the group through an invitation from María del Carmen, a neighbor, who suggested they seek support for their businesses.  The three members of the group are as follows:  

Deonila Gutiérrez M.: will invest her funds into the purchase of ingredients for making tamales, to later sell within her own community.

Carmela Hernández Sánchez: will invest her funds into materials for making doors, windows, and other items, to later sell.

María del Carmen N. G.: will invest her funds into ingredients for making bread.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making tamales to sell within her own community.

loans.name: Ruth Marinela

texts.es:
Doña Ruth, de 47 años de edad, reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, tiene su propia casa, donde vive con su esposo y una hija de 20 años de de edad; ella administra una tienda en la que ofrece productos de consumo como alimentos no perecederos y embutidos, detergentes entre otros, lo tiene ubicado en su casa y lo inicio hace 4 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de consumo, bebidas y detergentes, con esta inversión su negocio crecerá en mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes, mejorando su vida cotidiana.
Las aspiraciones de doña Ruth es que este negocio lo posea por varios años, que logre ganar ingresos suficientes para ayudar a su hija a superarse y garantizarle un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Mrs Ruth, age 47, lives in Jucuapa in the Usulutan department. She has her own home, where she lives with her husband and one daughter, age 20. She runs a store where she offers consumer products such as non-perishable food and sausages, detergents and other items. Her store is located in her home and she started it 4 years ago.

She is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of consumer products; drinks and detergents. With this investment her business will have more merchandise to offer her customers, thus improving her daily life. Her dream is that she will have this business for several years, and be able to make enough income to help her daughter to get ahead and to ensure a better future.

loans.use: to purchase consumer products; drinks and detergents.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Dulce Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad.  Es soltera y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.  Celia cuenta con educación superior. 
Trabaja  con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco  años.  Su préstamo inicial de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, lo utilizó en su negocio de venta de artículos artesanales como chompas, chalinas y otros.
Con éste crédito  de S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará diez conos de lanas para elaborar sus prendas, las mismas que venderá en el puerto. 
Su sueño es superarse en el negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad de las socias.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the “Dulce Amanecer” (Sweet Dawn) Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Puno district, Puno province, Puno department.  She is 44 years old, single, and has two school age children.  Celia has a post-secondary education.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  She used her first loan for 300 soles in her business of selling handmade items like sweaters, scarves, and other things. 

She will use this loan for 1,500 soles to buy ten spindles of wool yarn to make her garments, which she will sell at the port.

Her dream is to excel in her business and to improve her earnings.

What she likes about her communal bank is the members’ punctuality and responsibility.

loans.use: to buy ten spindles of wool yarn

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se llama RENACER; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la Provincia y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Vilma, la socia tiene 38 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 6 años y 6 meses el menor, la socia trabaja de manera independiente la compra y vende zapatos y zapatillas por catálogos a las diferentes instituciones públicas y privadas ella deja sus catalogos y en dos días los recoge y con los pedidos ingresa a su empresa a hacer los pedidos y en 2 semanas le están entregando los pedidos y ella los reparte a los diferentes clientes y pasa a recoger el dinero que es el pago de estos en 2 semanas más.
