loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is a fifty-year-old widowed mother of three children, two girls who are currently in high school and a boy in primary school. They live in the community of Bawjiase, near Accra, in the family house.

An industrious lady, Yaa operates a cold store in the local market square selling fresh fish purchased wholesale from larger establishments in Accra. She has been operating this business for 12 years and is now requesting a loan to buy the goods in bulk and acquire bigger refrigerators. Yaa hopes to increase her profit margin to enable her save more to support her family, especially her children’s education. Education is of utmost concern to her as she believes it is the best legacy a parent can leave a child.

Yaa is a member of a bank trust group called Special, whose members guarantee the repayment of each other’s loans.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish in bulk.

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kototala est composé des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et  3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles dans le village de Tinimbougou, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro  république du Mali. 
Ces femmes exercent essentiellement le commerce de condiments alimentaires.
Afin de satisfaire leur clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 200kg de sel de cuisine, 130kg d’oignon, 10 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi et une grande quantité de condiments divers. Ces produits sont achetés sur le marché de Dioïla avec les grossistes et revendus dans le marché local de Tinimbougou en détail au comptant et à crédit. Leur clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elles envisagent avoir 8 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune  qui sera utilisé pour agrandir la taille de leur activité.
texts.en:
The Kototala group is made up of married women who average 26 years of age and 3 children. They live in traditional families in the village of Tinimbougou, prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali. Their businesses essentially consists in selling food condiments.

To satisfy an ever-increasing clientele, they decided to join Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan). Former loans were repaid without problems. With this loan, they intend to buy 200 kg of salt, 130 kg of onions, 10 packs of 100 "Maggi" bouillon cubes, and a large amount of various condiments. These products are purchased from wholesalers at the Dioïla market, and retailed at the local market in Tinimbougou, for cash or on credit, to a clientele comprising mostly women. They foresee turning a profit of XOF 8'000 (ca US$ 16) each, to be used to expand their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and retail condiments (salt, onions, bouillon cubes, ...)

loans.name: Sofia Esperanza

texts.es:
La Sra. Sofia P. tiene 40 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa nueva, es notable su crecimiento y la administracion que le ha dado al mismo, ya que ella nos conto que con las ganacias que ha obtenido logro construir su casa y tambien logro comprarle una casa a una hija de ella la cual esta feliz con su matrimonio.
ademas tambien ha podido darles educacion  a sus hijos de los cuales dos de ellos ya son profesionales y le ayudan mensualmente en cosas para la casa.
de la familia ya solo depende uno y a este ella le cubre todos sus gastos completamente, el esta cursando la secundaria y luego piensa estudiar en la universidad para trabajar y ayudarle a su madre.
ella necesita el credito para poder invertir mas en productos y asi tener mayor variedad de productos, esto para tener mejores ganancias y asi poder salir adelante con su hogar.
para ella esta es la unica fuente de ingresos ya que es una señora de edad y solo esta actividad puede realizar.
texts.en:
Sofia P. has dedicated herself to the sale of new clothing for the past 40 years. The growth and administration that she has given her business is quite notable, as she has told us that with the profits she has obtained she was able to build her house and was also able to purchase a house for one of her daughters who is happily married. She has also been able to give an education to her children, two of which are now professionals and help her monthly with the household. Only one of her children is still dependent on Sofia and she completely covers all her expenses; her daughter is in secondary school and after hopes to continue onto university to work and help her mother. Sofia needs a loan to invest in more products and in that way have a better variety; this will allow her to earn better profits and be able to get ahead with her household. For Sofia this is the only source of income given that she is advanced in years and she can only carry out this activity.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pants, blouses, shirts, umbrellas, skirts, and bags.

loans.name: Ejiniyi

texts.en: Ejiniyi A. is 37 years old and married with 2 children. She sells planks.  She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
IRIS MANSICIDOR C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas”, con domicilio ubicado en la Urbanización el Bosque Mz. D Lt 9., en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, tiene 35 años de edad. Es profesora, pero se dedica a la Venta de sabanas y productos Leonisa (ropa interior femenina).  Su esposo realiza producción de documentales y tienen 4 menores hijos.

Ella tiene 2 años y medio trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar productos Leonisa y dedicarse a la venta de dichos productos, contribuyendo con los gastos en su hogar. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000. Nuevos Soles, comprará productos Leonisa (ropa interior), sábanas, algunos productos de belleza y dedicarse a la venta de dichos productos, con el fin de solventar los gastos de sus hijos.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque la apoya con los créditos y trabajar su propio capital.
texts.en:
IRIS MANSICIDOR C. belongs to the community bank “Las Margaritas”. Her home is located in the Urbanización el Bosque Mz. D Lt 9., in the district of Yarina Cocha. She is 35 years old. She is a teacher, but she works selling sheets and Leonisa products (women’s underwear). Her husband works making documentaries, and they have 4 young children. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for two and a half years. The first loan that she received was for the amount of S/ 300 Nuevo Soles. She used it to buy Leonisa products and to work at the sales of those products, contributing to the expenses of the household. With this loan of S/2.000 Nuevos Soles, she would buy Leonisa products (underwear), sheets, some beauty products, and work selling those products, with the goal of meeting the expenses of her children. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos, because of the help of the loans and to work her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy things to wear (underwear), sheets, and beauty products

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juanita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, vive en el Jr. Grimaldo Reàtegui   Nº 249, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 36 años y es madre de 3 hijos, 2 niña y 1 niño, los cuales aun dependen de ella y los que la alientan a seguir superando las dificultades que se le presentan.  La fortaleza y la perseverancia que la caracteriza la motivó a crear su propio negocio de venta de flores y regalos (esto gracias al primer crédito de S/. 300.00 que recibió).  De ahí en adelante, día a día, fue ganando clientela dado al buen trato que les brinda y los precio bajos que oferta. Actualmente continua con este negocio pero ya ampliado con otros productos considerando la demanda que tiene entre sus clientes que generalmente son sus amigos y vecinos del barrio donde vive. Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que cancelará en 06 meses, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio, como ropa para bebes, flores artificiales, artículos para regalos como accesorios para cocina, peluches, juguetes, cosméticos. Ella nos manifiesta que trabaja con mucho optimismo, agradeciendo la oportunidad de contar con prestamos que le ayudan a desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Juanita is a member of the communal bank "Las Trabajadoras." She lives in San Martin, in the Juanjui district, at 249 Jr. Grimaldo Reategui. Juanita is married, 36 years old, and the mother of 3 children (2 girls and 1 boy). Her children are what motivate her to face the difficulties life presents her with. Because Juanita is a strong woman who works hard, she was able to start her own business, selling flowers and gifts, with her first loan of 300 soles. Day-by-day she worked to grow her client base by treating her clients well and offering good prices. Currently she is continuing with the same business, but she is expanding. She will sell more products because of the high demand from her neighbors and friends, who are her clients. With this loan of 1,500 soles (that will be paid off in 6 months) she will buy more products to stock her store. She will purchase items like: baby clothes, artificial flowers, and gift items like kitchen accessories, stuffed animals, toys, and make up. She tells us that she is very optimistic and grateful for the opportunity to get a loan which helps her develop as a woman and as a small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de ropa para bebes, flores artificiales, accesorios para cocina, peluches, juguetes, cosméticos

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra en su decimo ciclo del programa de mujeres de la Fundacion Paraguay y es un comité ejemplar.  La presidente del comite es la Sra. Olga R..  Ella tiene 40 años y tiene 5 hijos. Dos de sus hijos pequeños se quedan en una guarderia y los otros tres se quedan en la en la casa mientras la madre se va a trabajar haciendo sus manicuras y pedicuros en la zona de Trinidad y los fines de semana se dedica a hacer  actividades con sus compañeras del comité para  crear una entrada mas en sus ahorros.

Ella es una señora muy dedicada a sus hijos que hace de todo tipo de trabajo para ayudar a su pareja en los gastos de la familia.  
Tiene una casita  pequeña hecha de materiales y vive cerca de un desague que les hace pasar malos momentos y que piensa comprarse otra casita para su estabilidad y la de su familia.

Las otras integrantes del comite son:

Olga Beatriz R. - 	manicurista - 
Marta A. - 	Vta de Bebidas - 
Gervacia V. -	Vta de Biyouteri - 
Aurora M. -  	Vta de comidas - 
Mirta C. -	Venta de cd y peliculas  -
 Mercedes V. - 	Manicurista - 
Tania S. -	Vta de merceria - 
Olga A. -	Vta de lenceria - 
Lucila C. -	Vta de Lenceria - 
Maria Laura M.  -
	Vta de golosinas - 
Limpia G.	-  Vta de cosmeticos - 
Liliana G. - 	Vta de ropas - 
Mirian A.	-  Vta de comestibles - 
Shirley S.   -	Vta de mercerias - 
Valentina M.  - 	costurera - 
Josefina R.  -	Vta de Articulos de limpieza - 
Wilma G. -	 Vta de comestibles -
texts.en:
The present committee is in its 10th loan cycle in the Fundacion Paraguay women’s program and it is an exemplary committee. The president of the committee is Mrs. Olga R.. She is 40 years old and has 5 children. Two of her children are in childcare and the other three at home while she works providing manicures and pedicures in the Trinidad area and on weekends she works with her committee friends to create other mechanisms for saving money. She is a very dedicated mother who does all kinds of work to help her husband with the family expenses. She has a small house near a drainpipe which creates some bad moments and she is thinking of buying another home for her and her family’s stability. The other members of the committee are: Olga Beatriz R. - manicurist - Marta A. - Sells beverages - Gervacia V. - sells jewelry - Aurora M. - sells food - Mirta C. - sells CDs and movies - Mercedes V. - manicurist - Tania S. - sells general merchandise - Olga A. - sells lingerie - Lucila C. - sells lingerie - Maria Laura M. - sells candy - Limpia G. - sells cosmetics - Liliana G. - sells clothing - Mirian A.- sells groceries - Shirley S. - sells general merchandise - Valentina M. - seamstress - Josefina R. - sells cleaning products - Wilma G. - sells groceries

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of products for their respective businesses

loans.name: Teko

texts.fr: Teko D. est un jeune homme de 37 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est propriétaire d’un pressing. afin d’être plus compétitive sur le marché et offrir à la clientèle un service de qualité, Teko souhaite acheter une machine à laver et d’autres outils de travail. Il espère aussi engager deux employés pour l’aider dans l’accomplissement de ses tâches.
texts.en:
Teko D. is a young man of 37, married and the father of 2 children. He owns a cleaner's. So as to be more competitive in the marketplace while offering his clients quality service, Teko hopes to buy a washing machine and other apparatus for his business. He also hopes to hire two employees to help him get his work done.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase a washing machine and other necessary apparatus

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida A. is a 34 year old woman. She is single and the mother with two children. She lives in the family house at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana.

Vida is a food vendor and serves food like rice and stew in the community where she lives. She prepares a tasty meal and, because of that, many people buy from her stand.

Vida says that demand for food is on the high side but she does not have adequate funds for expansion. She wants to use the loan to buy more meat and bags of rice to increase her ability to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support her children and finance their education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, fish, meat, vegetables etc. for her business

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary I. sells drinks and cooked foods. She is 53 years old and married with 7 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Doña Juliana de 57 años de edad, reside en el barrio Ayapal en la capital de Managua, casada con dos hijos mayores de edad, su esposo trabaja en servicio de seguridad, ella vende tortilla desde hace veintiún años ha podido captar clientes, y salir adelante con su familia, con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer la cocina y poder estar en mejor condiciones para realizar su trabajo. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios alcanzados.
texts.en:
Doña Juliana is 57 years old, married and the mother of two adult children. Her husband is a security guard. She lives in the neighborhood of Ayapal in the capital city of Managua.

Juliana has been selling tortillas for 21 years. She could attract many customers and move forward with her family. She will use this loan to buy building materials to upgrade her kitchen and have better working conditions. Juliana is thankful to the microfinance institution for the loan and her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to upgrade her kitchen

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina, a 40-year-old married mother of eight children, lives in Warri with her family. She sells madigan and flowers and  is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more flowers and cake material to sell. Thank you Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more flowers and cake material to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia manages a small store situated in front of their house. She really wants her business to become profitable so she is now requesting to borrow a loan from KIVA lenders in the amount of PHP9,000.00 for the growth of her store. With the assistance of this loan she believes that her income will increase and she can support the educational needs of their children.
Ofelia is 47 years old. She is married to Oscar who works as a farmer. They are living in South Caronsi, Peńablanca, Cagayan with their five children: Rosalie - 25 years old; Maricel - 24 years old; Jonas - 20 years old; Eleneor - 18 years old, a college student and Shiela May - 12 years old, in grade school.

loans.use: additional capital for the growth of her store

loans.name: Maite Guadalupe

texts.es: Maite Guadalupe R. de 22 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Chalatenango, Maite vive con su madre, juntas administran y atienden el negocio familiar; una tienda de productos de consumo básico y otros como ropa y papelería. Maite y su madre son muy conocidas en su colonia como personas trabajadoras y honestas. El crédito que solicita Maite es para surtir su negocio y convertirlo en una tienda de variedades, donde sus clientes puedan encontrar de todo, sin necesidad de buscar en otro lugar.
texts.en:
Maite Guadalupe R. is 22 years old and resides in the Chalatenango region. Maite lives with her mother, and together they administer and attend to the family business, a store that sells basic consumer products and other products such as clothes and stationery. Maite and her mother are well known in their neighborhood as hardworking and honest people. The loan that Maite is requesting will be used to supply her store and convert it into a variety store, where her customers can find everything without having to look anyplace else.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: supply her store

loans.name: Evelio

texts.es:
Evelio R. A. es un  señor de 58 años de edad quien vive con su esposa en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 

Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Como parte de las respuestas a esa situación, desde hace dos años se instaló en la comunidad una planta de elaboración de quesos, propiedad de la Asociación de Productores de Leche de El Sauce, hecho que motivó a don Evelio a iniciar en la producción de leche para luego venderla a esta planta. 
Asegura que su familia  se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante mucho tiempo, por lo que ha podido experimentar todos los cuidados que demanda, además de la instrucción recibida por parte de sus familiares  a lo largo del tiempo. 

Don Evelio desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera más y poder hacer crecer  su negocio ya que desea ser un microempresario exitoso y  así poder ayudar a que su familia siga adelante esto es una de las cosas que lo motiva a esforzarse y trabajar con mucho esmero.

Don Evelio es socio de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.

loans.use: Compra de una vaca lechera

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
35-year-old Glenda B. owns a motorcycle. She has a transportation business in Panglao, Bohol. She is married to Jose and they have seven children. Their eldest is 15 years old. Through the business she has, she is able to send her children to school.

She needs additional capital to finance her existing business. She would like to request a loan of PHP 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to purchase motorcycle spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
Nuon N. is 58 years old, married and a mother. She currently works for a cleaning company, while her husband is a domestic construction worker. Nuon N. has six children, three of whom are married and live independently and the three who are single and employed. 

Nuon N. and her husband are facing difficulties with their living situation because the spare part of their house need repair. Because of that, Nuon N. is applying for a US$500 loan to pay the cost of repairing her existing house. 

Note: Nuon N. was busy at her work, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To pay the cost of repairing her existing house

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San H., 30, and her husband, Bunthoeun Lao, 44, have been married since 1999 and have two children: one son and one daughter. One attends school and other one is still young.  They live in a small village off of National Road number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

San has been a Chinese translator for a garment factory for four years. Her husband has farmed for more than 20 years. He grows tomatoes and cucumbers.  San is applying for her first loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle to commute to work.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle to commute to work.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John sells electronics to make a living. He is 31 years old and single without children. He sells at the market in Agbor, Delta State.  He loves his business because it is highly competitive. He has been in this business for 5 years.

He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more electronics to sell. He hopes to own an electronics company in the future. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Estrellita Group

texts.es:
Lorena G., Sobeyda H., Ruth C. y Geraldine C. integran al grupo Estrellitas. Estas cuatro féminas del  barrio Memorial Sandino han trabajado arduamente durante este año para aumentar sus negocios y en estas fechas esperan seguir así.

 Lorena G. de 32 años inicio vendiendo frijoles cocidos empezó ahorrar parte de las ganancias y con los prestamos que obtuvo en adim pudo empezar a vender ropa y cosméticos lo cual le ayudado a mejorar su situación económica que era tan precaria.

Sobeyda H. de 28 años comercializa CD, frutas y verduras, Ruth C. vende zapatos y tiene una pequeña pulpería   y Geraldine C. empezó vendiendo hielo y helados después empezó a realizar frescos naturales y a ofrecer gaseosa.
texts.en:
Lorena G., Sobeyda H., Ruth C., and Geraldine C. comprise the Estrellitas group. These four women are from the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. They have worked arduously during this year to expand their businesses. These days they hope to continue in the same manner. Lorena G., 32, sells cooked beans. She started saving part of her earnings, and with the loans she got from ADIM, she was able to start selling clothing and cosmetics. This helped improve her precarious economic situation. Sobeyda H., 28, sells CDs, fruit, and vegetables. Ruth C. sells shoes, and she has a small mini market. Geraldine C. started selling ice and ice cream after she starting selling natural drinks and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Luz Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Chankas”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 49 años y es madre de 02 hijos,  que aun dependen de ella.

Luz Elena, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica a la venta de Refrigerios, como: juanes, tamalitos, arroz chaufa, arroz con pollo; ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Ciudad, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente atiende a sus clientes y tiene muy buena acogida, nos cuenta que se inicio por ella misma y con un capital de S/. 200.00. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos en kilos y huevos en javas, aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Se siente muy bien, para seguir con sus ventas de refrigerios. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Luz Elena, 49, is a member of the "Los Chankas" communal bank, which is in Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is single and has two dependent children. Luz Elena sells snacks like: juanes (grated and boiled yucca mixed with rice and either chicken or beef jerky wrapped in a banana leaf and steamed), little tamales, Chinese-style rice with chicken, in her city's central market. She has a well set-up area were her customers can enjoy her preparations daily. She is well-received. She tells us that she started out investing her own 200 soles. Now, she continues in the same line of work and she tells us that she does very well. With this 2500 sol loan she will buy ingredients for her dishes like: sacks of rice and sugar, kilos of chicken, crates of eggs, cooking oil by the dozen as well as some kitchen utensils to provide better customer service. She feels good to continue selling snacks and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and to reaching her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals preparation.

loans.name: Murod

texts.en: Murod is 45 years old and lives with his wife and six children. He is a humble person dedicated to growing crops. For five years he has grown different types of agricultural products and this activity takes all of his day. Early in the morning he leaves to work on the land and returns home in the evening. Agriculture has helped Murod to cover his home expenses. He enjoys being in contact with nature, although it’s hard to work with difficult weather conditions that affect his production. For Murod, having a healthy wife and happy children gives him strength to keep working hard. Murod will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for improving his land. This is why he requests 2,800 USD. He thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan without any violations. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up with kerosene for lamps

loans.name: Hugo Daniel

texts.es:
Hugo es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo de 12 años de edad en la ciudad de Reque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace 10 años a brindar servicio de tallado en piedra y a la elaboración de lápidas. Este trabajo consiste en tallar piedras para hacer decoraciones en fachadas e interiores de viviendas, por otro lado, aplica sus habilidades para elaborar lápidas fúnebres. Este negocio es su única fuente de ingreso con la que sustenta los gastos familiares por lo que da lo mejor de sí para salir adelante.

Sus habilidades le han permitido hacerse más conocido en la zona, y sus servicios encuentran cada vez mas demanda, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de materiales (piedras, cinceles y combas) con los cuales pueda seguir trabajando.

Hugo es una persona bastante responsable y muy comprometida con su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es poder hacer modelos en su casa ya que está construida de material rustico.
texts.en:
Hugo, 32, lives with his wife and 12-year-old son in Reque, which is 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last 10 years he has worked as a stone engraver and tombstone maker. The work consists in engraving stones to be used as decorations on facades or interiors of homes. On the other hand, he also applies his skills to making tombstones. This business is his family’s sole source of income; he gives his best to it, therefore, in order to succeed. His skills have made it possible for him to become more well-known in the area and his services are more in demand every day. For this reason, he has had to call upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a 1000 new sol loan. He plans to use the funds to buy supplies and materials (stone, chisels, stone engraving tools) with which to continue working. Hugo is quite a responsible person who is dedicated to his work. His greatest wish is to remodel his house because it is built with just rudimentary materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone working tools.

loans.name: Dinia

texts.en: Dinia E. is a 56 year-old industrious woman. Both she and her husband run a small business as a source of income to support the needs of their family. It was Dinia’s loan, received from ASHI previously, that has enabled her to start up her own hog/pig fattening business and to support her husband’s sales (various goods from the community) business. They both enjoy running their own business and have been able to pay back the full loan they received from ASHI. Now, they hope that the larger amount of loan they are requesting to Kiva through ASHI will be granted for them to have the opportunity to grow their businesses. They hope to increase their profits in order to continuously support their needs. They dream of having a better kind of life – a life that is not under the umbrella of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for fattening and raising.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma J. is from the village of  Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old and married with 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Norma has owned and operated a business making and selling food for over three years. The business's main source of income is selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community, which helps Norma earn approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI, which she used to to purchase additional products to sell. Norma is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be Norma's 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expand food / snack food business

loans.name: 32-Dien Bien Group

texts.en:
Nhung N. T. (150) is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Nhung is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 32-Dien Bien (03.08.32).


Nhung is married and has 2 adult children.  To making a living, Nhung owns & operates a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling flowers in the local community.  Nhung has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nhung is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    She is now requesting a loan of 4.248.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  Nhung plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Tam (151) is a 48-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


2.  N. T. Phuong (152) is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


3.  B. T. Thai (153) is a 60-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Nhung N. T. (150) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Nhung là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 32-Dien Bien (03.08.32).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hoa trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Nhung thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nhung kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Nhung đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nhung đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Tam (151) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


2.  N. T. Phuong (152) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3.  B. T. Thai (153) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata B. est une femme de 21 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KAMBENG DOUMASSOU depuis 2 ans et demis et a 5 fois de suite reçu de crédit et a toujours bien géré ses prêts et remboursé à temps. Elle est détentrice d'une boutique où elle vend différents produits alimentaires. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer sa boutique en achetant beaucoup plus de marchandises telles que des produits détergents, du riz, de l'huile végétale, du sucre, des boîtes de conserves etc.Elle est soutenu dans son activité par son mari par rapport au transport de la marchandise lors de l'approvisionnement. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatoumata B. is 21 years old, married and the mother of one child. She has been a member of the KAMBENG DOUMASSOU «Banc Villageois» loan group for 2 ½ years and has been granted five successive loans, all well managed and repaid on time. She owns a shop where she sells various food products (rice, vegetable oil, sugar, etc.) and detergents. This loan will help her grow her business by allowing her to buy large stocks of merchandise such as rice, detergents, vegetable oil, sugar, canned goods, etc. Her husband helps her transport merchandise when she needs to resupply. Her objective is to participate in improving the family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renforcer sa capital d'investissement et de faire la promotion de son activité

loans.name: Mia Ficeh

texts.en:
Mia Ficeh B. is from Oroquieta City. She is 22 years old and single. To make a living, Mia Ficeh owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products like food for snacks, candies, soap, sugar, salt, noodles, canned goods, etc. in the local community. Mia Ficeh has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Mia Ficeh joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan she has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat is a 23-year-old businessman. Since he was young, he has had a passion for technology and computers. Shuhrat trained as much as he could and, with a lot of effort, finished his education. Two years ago, he started a small Internet café. It offers services such as renting computers, making international and domestic calls, and photocopying. Shuhrat is at his store every day of the week as he is in charge of the business.

Right now, the Internet café needs an expansion in order to offer fax and scanner services and a small bookstore where the customers, mainly high school and college students, can meet when they need to. Shuhrat is requesting a loan to be able to purchase the necessary equipment and materials to offer his customers these services that are so much in demand. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase a new modern computer

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice Y. is currently in the business of selling dresses and bedsheets at the shop and is requesting a loan to stock pairs of trousers and shoes to sell.  Joice is 39 years old and is married with a husband that is a teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a bakery.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock pairs of trousers and shoes to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene M. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 52 years old. Arlene is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing cell phone loads and selling electronic products in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Arlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business.

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor P. L.   es una joven  de 18 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y su  hijo en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.
Flor  tiene un pequeño terreno en el cual   ha sembrado diferentes cultivos tales como papaya y plátano, pero desde hace tres años ella se dedica a la siembra de ñame  un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Costa Rica como en otros países. Asegura que desde que se dedica solo a este producto sus ingresos han aumentado.
Actualmente Flor está solicitando un préstamo de ¢623,000 (seiscientos veinte y  tres  mil colones) para ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del ñame.
Doña Flor  es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer   préstamo y espera aprovecharlo al máximo y seguir teniendo acceso a este de tipo de Créditos.
texts.en:
Flor P. L. is an 18 year-old youth who lives with her husband and their son in a community called Santa Fe, located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. This community is in a mountainous region that is located very close to the northern border of the country. The main economic activities are livestock and agriculture, specifically the cultivation of staple grains, sugar cane and oranges. Flor has a small piece of land where she has cultivated different crops such as papaya and bananas, but three years ago she started to grow yams. Yams are root vegetables that taste good, are rich in nutrients and are processed in large volume by the local agro-industry. There is great demand for this product in Costa Rica as well as in other countries. She tells us that since she dedicated her production entirely to this product her income has increased. Now Flor is requesting a loan of 623,000 Costa Rican colones to help with the preparation of the soil by purchasing of seeds, fertilizers and other supplies that are needed to guarantee the optimal cultivation of yams. Flor is a member of the communal bank "Manatial de Santa Fe," one of the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and she hopes to take maximum advantage of it and to continue to have access to this type of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies to improve her land

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, a 50-year-old married father of five children, all attending school, has been farming for the last 10 years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces bananas and milk which he sells to the local market. He also operates a general shop in the same area.

John's biggest challenges in farming have been competition leading to lower prices and getting a high quality breed of dairy animal. However, in the future he hopes to have five quality dairy cows which will earn him a daily income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings and enable him to service a loan of more than one million Kenyan Shillings.

John has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand his poultry project. He says that the extra income from this loan will enable him pay school fees for his children. He hopes that with the decrease in lending rates by the Central Bank, Juhudi will look at their interest rate.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Merlyn D. is from the village of Sangay Diot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years of age, married and is blessed with 6 children of whom all are now school-aged.  To make a living, she is presently engaged in a snack vending activity. She is also receiving regular support from her husband as a farmer. She’s been engaged in this kind of business (snack vending activity) for 3 years already and earns approximately Php 3,000 a month from this business activity.

In the year 2006, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out to the rural communities, Merlyn has successfully repaid a loan of Php 13,000. She is requesting a loan in the amount of Php 30,000 as her 9th loan to be used for the redemption of a parcel of agricultural land and any remaining amount for the snack vending business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of their family especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayments, children’s education, insurance and possible business expansions. 
		
About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Redemption of agricultural land and additional capital for her snack vending activity

location.town: Ozamis-Sangay Diot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline R. is from the village of Flores, Naguillan, Isabela. She is 42 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Evangeline owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Evangeline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be her 2nd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Aimee

texts.en:
Aimee is 34 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her eldest child is 7 years old, the next is 4 years, and the last one is 7 months of age. Aimee's husband works in a beauty salon. 

Aimee owns a business selling food. Her business is profitable. She has four years of experience. She works from 6 in the morning to 5 in the evening every day except Saturday.

Aimee is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing more food. With her business expansion, Aimee will be able to change her life conditions and provide the necessities for her family.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Sar's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sar C., 35 years old, is the leader of a group loan, selected by the 5 members located in Samraong K'aer village, Kandal province. C. and her husband, Mr. Buth Bunthy, 35 years old, are pig breeders at their home. They are working hard to support their four children aged between 14-6 years old.
 
C. and her husband are pig breeders but now they face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their business. Thus C. decided to ask for a loan through AMK to buy pig feed for pig raising. Aside from being farmers they are also have a piece of land to cultivate vegetables so that they are able to earn some profit, together with pig breeding, to support the family.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for pig raising

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 57-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She used to work as a traveling saleswoman selling underwear and lingerie almost 30 years ago. Two years ago, she opened a formal store to present her products to her customers. She obtained her first Kiva loan and she was very reliable with her monthly payments. Thankful for the results of the first loan, she is requesting today to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store inventory to attract more clients to her shop and reinforce her business. In the future, she hopes to add clothes to her shop to expand her occupation.

loans.use: To increase her store inventory

loans.name: Faustina Ekua Owusuwaa

texts.en:
Faustina Ekua Owusuwaa O. is divorced and has seven dependents. She has no educational background. She sells doughnuts and porridge at Abura, which she has been doing for the past five years. Faustina will add the loan to her initial capital so she can expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further her dependents' education.

Faustina has in her hands samples of the way she bags the porridge for her customers.

loans.use: add the loan to her initial capital

loans.name: Leocadio

texts.en:
Leocadio V. is from the village of Holy Friday. He is 46 years old. Leocadio is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 23 years and earns approximately $117 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leocadio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Leocadio is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 3rd loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Reuben C.

texts.en:
Reuben C. K. is 50 years old, married to Margaret Chepkonga, and they have eight children aged between 26 and 10 years old. 
  
Reuben runs butchery at Kapkiamo trading centre few kilometers from Kabarnet town. He has been in this business for almost 17 years, and his average monthly profit from the business is Kshs 4,000. He has applied for his third loan of Kshs.20,000 from KADET, after successfully paying back the previous loans. He intends to use the loan to purchase goats for slaughter to meet the demand during the  festive season. 
  
He anticipates using his profits to start maize and horticulture farming in order to increase his income. His hopes and dreams are to have a big business and give his children the best education.

loans.use: To purchase  animals for slaughter

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana Patricia U. S. a sus 34 años es madre de 3 hijos y si algo tiene claro en la vida es que además de ser empresaria para garantizar el sustento de su familia, desea estar muy de cerca de sus hijos a fin de acompañar su proceso de formación.
Para cumplir estos dos propósitos y teniendo en cuenta la experiencia que años atrás adquirió en la actividad avícola, esta emprendedora montó su propio negocio de cría de pollos.  Realizar esta labor le ha traído grandes satisfacciones puesto que además de que le ha permitido sacar a su familia adelante, como el negocio lo tiene en su propia casa ha podido estar muy cerca de sus hijos para ser testigo de su crecimiento y, con su experiencia, ir inculcándoles desde ya la importancia de tener un negocio propio.
Para seguir desempeñando su actividad, Diana tiene la necesidad de acondicionar mejor su galpón y comprar más aves, por ello requiere un crédito, que de obtenerlo está segura incidirá positivamente en su desarrollo como empresaria y, por supuesto, en un mejor futuro para sí misma y su familia.
texts.en:
Diana Patricia U. S., age 34, has three children.  If there is one thing clear in life, it is that in addition to being a businesswoman in order to guarantee the support of her family, she wishes to be close to her children during their formative years.

In order to achieve both objectives, and keeping in mind the experience she gained in the past in the poultry business, this entrepreneur started her own business raising chickens.  Doing this work has given her great satisfaction.  In addition to allowing her to get her family ahead, the business is at her own house.  She has been able to be with her two children as they grow up.  With her experience she is now instilling them with the importance of having your own business.

In order to continue working with her business activity, Diana needs to fix up her chicken coop and buy more birds.  That is why she needs a loan.  Upon obtaining a loan, she is sure that it will positively affect her development as a businesswoman.  Of course, it will also make for a better future for herself and her family.

loans.use: To fix up the chicken coop and buy more birds

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal S. is a 54-year-old widow woman who resides in the province of Kompong Tom. She has no life partner because her husband passed away many years ago. She now lives with eight children, six of whom are single and living under her management. The other two are married and living in their own houses already. Three of her kids are sewing workers in the local factory, and have a fixed salary every month.

Phal S. earns a living by raising pigs behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also cultivates a rice crop.  In order to gain extra income, she will be using the loan to buy more pig feed and piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy more pig feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah K. is thirty one years old and married. The husband is a sales man with a local company and they have two children aged eight years old and three and half years old. Her business is located at Pipeline and is well known by the name Kongowea Ndogo. She is served by the Kitengela branch. She owns a general store in which sells such items as detergents, beverages and others. Besides this business she sells groceries to the local people. She has been in this business for the last four years and has managed to provide employment to two people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is there are so many people doing the same kind of business as hers in the area and so customers are not loyal as they are spoiled with choices. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to restock her shop to meet the demands of her customers. She sees herself buying land and building her own house some day. She describes herself as aggressive and ambitious.

loans.use: Beverages, detergents and vegetables

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame A. is a seamstress at Abbrem Agona near Abura. Maame has been through junior high school. She is married and has one child. Maame has been a seamstress for four years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy materials and other sewing equipment to enable her to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy materials and other sewing equipment to enable her to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida J. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 45 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nelida raises pigs for fattening and sale. Nelida also helps her husband at their rice farm by working to keep the crops healthy. 

Nelida joined Kiva field partner CEVI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelida has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nelida is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase rice seed, fertilizer and pig feed.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed, fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Yolys Lucia

texts.es:
Yolys de 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora que trabaja vendiendo productos Avon y Esika (compañías que vender productos de uso personal a crédito).  

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con las ventas que realiza ya que da a sus clientes una comodidad de pago a crédito. Vende perfumes, cremas, blusas, pantalones etc. Tiene tres hijos de 18, 17, 12 años de edad. Quiere darles una buena vida por eso ella quiere continuar trabajando pero por ahora con el crédito quiere comprar materiales de construcción para su vivienda como cemento, bloques, arena. En el futuro quiere construir su casa de dos pisos para darle una buena vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolys, 38, is a hardworking woman who sells Avon and Esika products (companies that sell personal products on credit). 

She has a lot of hope for increasing her sales, now that she gives her clients the option of buying on credit.  She sells perfumes, creams, blouses,  trousers, and so on.  She has three children, who are 18, 17, and 12.   She wants to give them a good life, and this is why she needs to continue working, but this loan will be used to buy construction materials for her home, such as cement, cinder blocks, and sand.  In the future, she wants to build a multi-level house so as to give her children better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks and cement

loans.name: Mercedes María

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal 8 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo, está rodeada por maravillosas playas de clima cálido y agradable, con mujeres hermosas y luchadoras.

Aquí conocimos a la señora  Mercedes, ella tiene 60 años y está casada hace ya 34 años, no pudo tener hijos pero tiene tres chicos  que crio desde pequeños como si fueran suyos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y una linda niña de 6 años que está en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en la cooperativa Coactur.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza y perfumería) y Leonisa (ropa interior para damas). Trabaja todos los días en las tardes, dice que ya lleva en el negocio de Yanbal 14 años y que tuvo varios problemas al principio pero que ahora ya no gracias a que tiene muchos clientes, pero en las prendas intimas recién comenzó hace poco, además nos cuenta que con el crédito anterior también empezó a vender prendas de damas y ahora tiene muchos pedidos.

Con este crédito lo va  ir Guayaquil y  a Quito a comprar ropa de damas ya que tiene varios pedidos y quiere aumentar sus clientes. Es su sexto  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos crece en su negocio.

Su meta es seguir adelante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
The May 8th Community Bank meets every other week in the beautiful city of Portoviejo. It is surrounded by marvelous beaches with a warm and pleasant climate, and has beautiful and spirited women. Here we find Mrs. Mercedes. She is 60 years old and has been married for 34 years. She could not have children but has raised three children since they were young as if they were her own. Two of them are now grown and the other, a lovely girl, is six years old and in school. Her husband works for Coactur.

She works selling Yanbal beauty products and Leonisa, a brand of women's underwear. She works every day in the afternoon. She says she has had her Yanbal business for 14 years and that at the beginning there were problems with it but not any longer thanks to her many customers. She only recently began selling lingerie, and shared that her last loan helped her begin selling it, and that she now has many orders.

With this loan she will go to Guayaquil and Quito to buy women's clothing since she has many orders and also wants to increase her clientele. This is her sixth loan with the Community Bank and she likes it because the loans help her business grow. Her goal is to keep moving forward with her business.

loans.use: buy women's clothing

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José es un joven de 20 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de medicina y ropa, vive con su esposa y una hija de 5 años, su esposa trabaja, dependiendo únicamente de sus ingresos la hija. El inicio el negocio por ayuda de su hermana, aprendió el  oficio y hoy día es el que provee para su hogar.
El necesita realizar una inversión que le permita tener variedad de mercadería, para atender a la clientela de una forma más eficiente, por tal razón solicita un préstamo del cual espera comprar ropa y medicamentos para sus dos negocios.
Su objetivo es en el corto plazo, establecer un negocio con más cobertura en la zona, que atienda a más personas y le ayude a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: José  is a young man, 21, who lives in San Rafael Oriente in the Department of San Miguel.  He makes a living selling medicine and clothing and lives with his wife and five year old daughter, who count on his income.  He started this business with help from his sister and leaned what to do.  Today he provides for his home.  He needs to make an investment that will allow him to have a variety of merchandise to attend to customers more efficiently.  This is why he is taking out a loan so he can buy clothing and medicine for his business.  His short-term goal is to establish a business that covers more area, assists more customers, and helps him improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase medicine and clothing to sell.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Irma Galinda

texts.es:
Irma de 52 años, es una mujer inspiradora que salió adelante en su negocio vendiendo pelota y zapatos deportivos para una cancha que queda cerca de su casa.

Ella labora de 7H00 am a 8H00 pm. Su mayor dificultad es la delincuencia ya que varias veces le han robado ya que su sector se ha vuelto peligroso. Con el préstamo quieres comprar más mercadería para su papelería, cuadernos, plumas. En un futuro desea surtir mas su papelería y que su sus hijos estén más cerca de ella para que la ayuden.
texts.en:
Irma is 52 years old.  She is an inspiring woman who got ahead with her business selling balls and athletic shoes for a court near her house.

Irma works from 7:00am to 8:00pm.  Her biggest problem is crime, as her neighborhood has become dangerous; she has been robbed a number of times.  With the loan, she wants to purchase merchandise for her stationary store, like notebooks and pens.  In the future, she wants to further supply her stationary store and for her children to live closer to her so they can help her.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies, notebooks, pens and stationary.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina nació en la comunidad de Vilcabamba distrito de Caicay de la provincia del Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 44 años edad, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en la comunidad de Huambutio. (La comunidad de Huambutio se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona ganadera y agrícola, esta comunidad está ubicada a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco).

Su actividad económica principal de Justina es hacer jora de maíz, ella tiene posos donde hace fermentar el maíz. Su actividad económica complementaria es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas, ella también tiene ganado como por ejemplo vacas, toros, caballos, etc.  Justina requiere el microcrédito para comprar de maíz, ella también va comprar animales como gallinas y cuyes. 

Justina pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Justina was born in Vilcabamba community, in Caicay district, in Paucartambo province, in Cusco department.  She is 44 years old, has four children, and lives in Huambutio community (Huambutio community is noted for its beautiful landscape, as well as its farming and livestock raising.  It is located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco).

Justina's main business activity is making 'jora de maíz' (a corn-based drink).  She has special wells where she ferments her corn.  She also has a sideline business which is raising animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She also has livestock such as cows, bulls, horses, etc.  Justina needs this loan to buy corn.  She will also buy animals such as hens and guinea pigs.

Justina is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Mamacha del Carmen" community bank.  The bank is in its third year and is doing very well.

loans.use: to buy animals such as guinea pigs and hens

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es:
María Laura  tiene 48 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

María se dedica al comercio de legumbres y a la agricultura tiene 3 cuadras de terreno, siembra maíz, papas, arveja, habas tiene 2 cabezas de ganado, 3 cerdos y 5 borregos.. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar e incrementar el negocio y dar el estudio a los hijos.

Le gusta salir a pasear, comprar en la ciudad de Guaranda, festejar las fiestas de carnaval y de San Pedro.
texts.en:
María Laura is 48 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  She has five children.

The Pucara Group community bank is located in Pucara community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton, 15 minutes from Cooperativa's offices.  This bank has 22 members who work in farming, livestock raising and vegetable sales.

María sells vegetables and farms.  She has 4.75 acres of land where she grows corn, potatoes, peas and beans.  She also has 2 head of cattle, 3 pigs and 5 lambs.  She makes her purchases in Guaranda market and her sales in the wholesale market in Guaranda.

María is requesting this loan to buy supplies and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to improve and increase her business, and to provide her children with an education.

María enjoys going for walks, making purchases in the city of Guaranda, and celebrating Carnaval and the San Pedro fiestas.

loans.use: to buy supplies and feed for her animals

loans.name: Chopoklaj Group

texts.es:
Don Cristobal tiene 45 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. contar con estudios, tiene 6 hijos 1 D. los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio D. joyas, inicio su negocio con solo una bandeja pequeña D. joyas y ahora tiene 15 años D. experiencia en este negocio, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domesticos del hogar. 

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo a ASDIR que le servirá para comprar mas mercaderías: aretes, cadenas, relojes, etc, la cual pueD. ser D. oro o D. fantasía. Los demás integrates del grupo se dedican al comercio y a la artesanía. En el futuro desea contar con un local propio para la venta D. joyas.
texts.en:
Cristobal is 45 years old. He didn't have the opportunity to go to school. He has six children, one of whom is in school. Cristobal earns his living selling jewelry. He started out with only one small shelf of jewelry and today he has 15 years of experience in this business. He counts on the support of his wife who handles the household chores.

Cristobal organized a group to request a loan from ASDIR in order to buy more merchandise: earrings, chains, watches etc. These could be either gold jewelry or costume jewelry. The other members of the group are salespeople and artisans. In the future, Cristobal would like to have his own jewelry store.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry.

loans.name: Angela Paola

texts.es:
La cliente es comerciante, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropas para damas y caballeros, tiene su propio local y clientela formada en toda la ciudad.
La señorita es soltera, sin hijo, vive con sus padres, estudia y también realiza trabajos de Auditoría para algunas empresa en particular.
Es una persona joven, estudiosa y muy trabajadora con muy buenas referencias en la sociedad.
Agradece a la institución por los buenos servicios prestados como así también ella se compromete a cumplir en tiempo y forma con la responsabilidad en caso de adquirir el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
This borrower is a saleswoman who buys and sells men's and women's clothes.  She owns her own sales premises and has customers throughout the city.  This lady is single and doesn't have any children.  She lives with her parents, studies, and also carries out auditing work for some private companies.

The borrower is a young, studious, hard-working woman who has very good references.  She is grateful to the institution for the services they have provided her with.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time and in full on receiving the loan she has requested.

loans.use: to buy jackets, tracksuits, pants and coats

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 58-year-old married man with six children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in poultry farming and rearing goats for 10 years in which he started with local chicken and now has layers. His is challenged by thieves who target his farm for chicken. He dreams of having two big poultry farms plus educating his children. Edward needs the loan to buy chicks for his poultry farm and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy chicks for his poultry farm and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Itacuan Group

texts.es:
Este  grupo se llama   Itacuán, sus integrantes decidieron ponerle así por que así se llama su pueblo, cuenta con diez  integrantes que debén reunirse cada catorce días para realizar sus pagos.
Tienen  un representante  y un comité  quien los gobierna, este grupo esta ubicado en el estado de Oaxaca. El grupo esta conformado por mujeres.
El representante  se llama  Araceli, estudio hasta  la secundaria, tiene un total  de tres hijos, dos mujeres y un varón .Ella se dedica  a vender antojitos mexicanos  y guisados.
