Sus clientes   le piden  que  haga su local ya que ella se dedica a entregar la comida a las casas y a las escuelas.
Araceli desea el préstamo  para  aumentar su negocio y tener un local para que sus clientes vayan a comer, vean la televisión  y se sientan como en casa.
Otro miembro  es  la señora  Carmen ,  tiene  cincuenta y siente años de edad  , estudio  hasta quinto grado de primaria, tiene un  total de  dos hijo, son varones .
Ella se dedica  a la venta de tamales, también vende  antojitos mexicanos en las noches, sus clientes le recomiendan  que venda los tamales  todas  las  tardes ya que  los hace cada  tercer  día por la falta de insumos y  tiene que viajar a la  ciudad de Pinotepa para comprarlos.
Unos de sus grandes sueños de Doña Carmen es  tener  mas ingresos para contratar personal, para  hacer su negocio mas grande y  darle mas atención a las personas que van a visitar a su pueblo.
Las otras  ocho  integrantes son:	
Heriberta  Rafaela: se dedica ala  venta de quesos.
Emma  - se dedica  a la  venta de quesos.
Francisca-  compra  y  venta de gasolina.
Elizabeth- se dedica a la venta de antojitos  mexicanos.
Eufemia-   se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Luisa-  se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
 Matilde- se dedica  a la venta de tamales.
Maria del Carmen: a la venta de tamales.

Le dan las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que les ha dado, para  hacer   realidad  sus sueños y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The name of this group is Itacuán.  The members decided to give it this name because that is the name of their town.  There are ten members, and they need to meet every two weeks in order to make their payments.

They have a representative and a committee which governs them.  This group is in the state of Oaxaca.  The group is comprised of women.

Araceli is the representative.  She went to school up until high school.  She has three children, two girls and a boy.  She sells Mexican snacks and stews.  Her customers ask her to set up a place because she delivers the food to houses and schools.
Areceli wishes to have the loan to increase her business.  She also wants to have a place where her customers go to eat, watch television, and feel like they are at home.

Carmen, age 50, is another member.  She went to school up to the fifth grade in elementary school.  She has two sons.  She sells tamales.  She also sells Mexican snacks in the evenings.  Her customers recommend that she sell the tamales every afternoon.  She now makes them every third day because of the lack of ingredients.  She has to travel to the city of Pinotepa to buy them.

One of Carmen’s biggest dreams is to have more income in order to hire personnel.  This will make her business bigger, and it will give the people who are going to visit her town more service.

The other eight members are:

Heriberta Rafaela: sells cheese.
Emma – sells cheese.
Francisca- buys and sells gasoline.
Elizabeth- sells Mexican snacks
Eufemia- sells chickens.
Luisa- sells Mexican snacks.
Matilde- sells tamales.
Maria del Carmen: sells tamales.

They are grateful to the Fundación for the support it has given them to make their dreams come true and to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make food.

location.town: Cruz del Itacuan, Pinotepa Nacional; Oaxaca

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 38 years of age and single. She lives with her brother. She didn’t want to become a burden to her brother so she started a business sewing clothes. She is very skilful and receives regular orders from customers in her neighborhood as she is known for her good work.
Kalsoom's brother is a jeweler by profession and operates his business from the market. He deals in gold, silver and artificial jewelry. Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to support her brother. With the loan, he will buy artificial jewelry in larger quantities to be able to sell to his customers to make a better profit. He is very experienced in his business and has been working in this area for the past 20 years. Kalsoom is confident that an investment will put his business in a more profitable position.

loans.use: to buy artificial jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina, 36 years old, owns a small café. Her husband is working in his rubber plantation. Their income is $18 per day. She has two children. Both of them are studying. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $10 on electricity, $30 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a plot of land to expand her rubber plantation. In the future, she hopes to buy the land near by her rubber plantation to expand her business so that she is able to send her children to study to become a doctor after they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land to expand her rubber plantation

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma es una mujer emprendedora, quien vive en compañía de su esposo e hijos a los que cría en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de San Ramón (selva central peruana). Su vida cambio radicalmente, pues tubo que enfrentar muchos inconveniente para salir adelante. Hace 20 años ayuda a su esposo en su farmacia “San Pedro” (en honor al patrón que tiene las llaves del cielo), pero como deseaba generar sus propios ingresos, alquiló un local en una zona céntrica para que funcione como locutorio asimismo pensó que podía aprovechar para vender dulces, caramelos, galletas, bebidas gasificadas y refrescos  - productos muy solicitados por el calor que caracteriza a la selva peruana, todo iba bien hasta que por problemas familiares tuvo que cerrar. Por eso con la experiencia que tiene en el comercio, planea reabrir su negocio para que pueda ahorrar las ganancias que percibirá, además tiene pensado instalar una bodega para poder obtener mejores ganancias y así ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Gotitas de rocío” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Razón por lo que promete ser puntual en sus cuotas. Norma de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de mercadería (refrescos, bebidas gasificadas y dulces) para vender en su nueva tienda, por lo que necesita aproximadamente mil nuevos soles.
texts.en: Norma is an enterprising woman.  She lives with her husband and children in a house they own in San Ramon, a town in Peru's central selva.  Her life took a big turn when she had to overcome hardships to get ahead.  She used to help her husband operate a pharmacy, called San Pedro (or St. Peter, in honor of the keeper of the keys to heaven) but she decided, 20 years ago, that she needed an extra income so she rented a space and opened a "locutorio" (to provide phone-calling services).  She realized, too, that she could use the store to sell merchandise that is always in demand in this hot, wet part of Peru: snacks, sweets, crackers, soft drinks, etc.  The business was a good one until family problems forced her to close it.  Now, with the experience she's gained, she wants to reopen the business so that she can increase her income and save for what she might need in the future.  She's also thinking about opening a general store, selling a wider range of everyday products that everyone needs.  Norma belongs to the "Gotitas de rocio" community bank and this is her fifth MFP loan.  She is relying on your support to meet her goals and she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.  She will use the 1,000 new soles loan to buy merchandise (soft drinks, snacks, etc.) for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIMANCACHA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosario; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de joyas, ella vende aretes, collares y pulseras, la socia vende las joyas en forma independiente, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de joyas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar joyas como pulseras, collares y aretes al por mayor. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "QORIMANCACHA" which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Rosario, 50, is married and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling jewelry such as earrings, necklaces and bracelets.  She sells her products independently and works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  Through her work she has been able to provide for her children.  She wants to expand her business and is requesting a loan to buy wholesale jewelry such as bracelets, necklaces and earrings.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale jewelry such as bracelets, necklaces and earrings.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph had been planting rice in his half hectare plot of land for almost 10 years. He goes down to the field everyday to ensure good crop production. Last harvest season of May, Joseph earned a yield amounting P20,000. He used it to pay tuition fees and allowances for his three children attending their secondary education.

Joseph is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides used in farming. 

In the future, he wants to earn consistent profits to continuously send his children to their college education, to have their own degree and good employment someday. He also wants to make his family more economically stable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
This is Arcelita, 44, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Renato, an overseas contract worker. She is a mother to her three children. Two are already studying in elementary school and one is still staying at home. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Arcelita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she sells mineral water for added income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 250 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Arcelita hopes her business will be stable and dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Jocelyn has a rice field and she harvests and sells rice grains in due time. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

loans.name: Señor De Los Temblores De Quello Quello Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Señor D. los Temblores D. Quello Quello” y se reúnen  cada treinta días en la comunidad D. Quello Quello del distrito D. Pisaq D. la provincia del Cusco. El banco comunal se distingue por estar conformado por gente trabajadora, artesanos y comerciantes. El grupo está conformado por once integrantes y son varias vez que solicitan un préstamo D. la Asociación Arariwa y el dinero lo invertirán para mejorar sus negocios. 

En esta reunión conocimos a la señora Lourdes, ella tiene 29 años D. edad y tiene dos hijos, ella se dedica  a la crianza D. animales menores, a la agricultura y también se dedica a la artesanía. DesD. joven se caracterizo por ser una persona responsable y amable y por ese motivo sus vecinas le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal. 

Lourdes en sus horas libres se dedica a pintar cerámica, ella realiza estos trabajos en su domicilio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo pinturas y pinceles. (En la fotografía la socia Lourdes está levantando la mano).
texts.en:
This group is called “Señor D. los Temblores D. Quello Quello” and they meet every thirty days in the city of Quello Quello in Pisaq District, Cusco Province.  The communal bank is notable for being composed of hardworking artisans and merchants.  The group has 11 members and they’ve requested several loans from Asociación Arariwa; they will invest the money in their businesses.

We met Lourdes, 29, at this meeting.  She has two children and raises small farm animals, farms and is a craftswoman.  Since a young age she stood out as being a responsible, kind person.  Because of that her neighbors invited her to participate in the communal bank.

In her free time Lourdes paints ceramics.  She does all her jobs at home and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy more supplies like paint and paint brushes, for example.

(In the photo, Lourdes is raising her hand.)

loans.use: to buy more supplies like paint and brushes.

loans.name: No-Matter Group

texts.en: Melinda, is a single lady aged 34. She lives in Mvuma with her three children aged 17,14 and 9. Two of her children attend school. She is a cross-border trader and operates in a flea market as well. She sells cosmetics and jewellery and the business has been in operation for than 20 years. She does not have any employees. She sees herself building her own house and in a position to pay school fees for her children if her business is adequately funded.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and jewellery for resale

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio's goal in life is to provide a better living for his family. To make a living, he raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice which he also sells. He has been growing rice since 2000. His family is not well-off and he relies on the income generated from the business. He needs to improve his crop production but he has insufficient funds to buy inputs. He is now asking for a loan of P25,000 to purchase fertilizers and seed for his farm.

Bonifacio is 44 years old and has four school-aged children. He usually pays P3,000 for their tuition fees. 

He wants to improve his farming practices to increase his earnings and thus provide a successful living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seed for his farm

loans.name: Wakwetu Group

texts.en:
Josephine is the facilitator of the Wakwetu group. Josephine and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Josephine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Josephine had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Josephine was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from her maize sales, Josephine will save for the future and repay her loans.

In 2012, the members of Wakwetu group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Josephine with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Bienvinido

texts.en:
Bienvinido is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with five children.

Bienvinido has a shop that sells bananas, coconuts, and vegetables. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy bananas and coconuts for resale.

Bienvinido has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Bienvinido hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy bananas and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Frontera De San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la ciudad de Caacupé. Ellas están muy satisfechas muy satisfechas con el apoyo que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva, ya que por medio de esta ayuda ellas se ven con un paso más hacia cumplir sus objetivos. El comité está en el ciclo número 2, con 12 integrantes.
Nelida es una de las miembros del grupo, comenta que se dedica a la peluquería. Por medio de su negocio ella puede mantener a su familia y ayudar con los gastos de la casa. Comenta que tiene una buena cantidad de clientes gracias a la buena atención que les da y gracias a los buenos precios que tiene. Uno de sus objetivos es seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder ser más conocida y atraer a más clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, spray y demás insumos necesarios para su peluquería. Está agradecida por la ayuda que le da la fundación y kiva, por que le será muy útil para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The women in this communal bank are from the city of Caacupé. They are very satisfied with the support that Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva have provided them, as this help has put them one step closer to achieving their goals. They are in their second loan cycle and have 12 members.

Nelida, a hairdresser, is one member of this group. Through her business, she is able to support her family and to help with household expenses. She comments that she has a good number of customers thanks to the good service she provides and her good prices. One of her objectives is to continue growing so that she can become more well-known and attract more clients. She is requesting this loan to buy hair dyes, shampoo, rinses, hairspray, and other necessary products for her beauty salon. Nelida is grateful for Fundación Paraguya and Kiva's help, as it will be very useful in helping her to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, shampoo, rinses, hairspray and other supplies

loans.name: Joemar

texts.en:
Joemar, is single with one child. He is 26 years old, and lives at Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte: Philippines. To earn a living, Joemar operates a business selling seafood products including crabs, fish and shrimp in the local community. He has been in the business for two years. Each month, he earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of business. 

Joemar requested a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. In 2010, Joemar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Joemar wants to save to have a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Canastitas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Canastitas, está conformado por la señora Jacinta va a comprar con su préstamo zapatos, tenis y catálogos, el joven Antolín va a comprar herramienta gatos, dados, matracas para arreglar autos, la señora María de los Ángeles va a comprar vara, madera, clavos y barniz para la elaboración de canastos. La señora Jacinta tiene 40 años de edad, ella estudio hasta la secundaria, ella vive en unión libre, ella tiene una niña que estudia la primaria, ella vende zapatos por catalogo, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar tenis y zapatos de dama y caballero para surtir sus pedidos. Ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años le ofrecieron vender por catalogo los zapatos y le enseñaron a vender, ella sale a ofrecer sus productos con sus vecinos en su comunidad, su negocio es importante porque va ganando y a ella le gusta vender, ella esta orgullose de su negocio se va ayudando para comprar para la comida o algo que falte en la casa, sus clientas son las jóvenes, señoras y maestras, su negocio es popular porque ya la conocen, ella está feliz con esta oportunidad porque este préstamo que va a recibir lo va a utilizar para comprar zapatos y darles a sus clientas mejor servicio. Sus sueños y esperanza son que crezca su negocio y sacar adelante a su hija que no le falte nada y que siga estudiando.  Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad gracias por prestarnos, esperamos crecer nuestros negocios y gracias por confiar en nosotros”.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Canastitas." It consists of Señora Jacinta, who is going to use her loan to buy tennis shoes and shoes from catalogs; the young man Antolín, who is going to buy jacks, wrenches, and a ratchet set to repair cars; and Señora Maria de los Angeles, who is going to buy reeds, wood, nails, and varnish to make baskets. 

Señora Jacinta is 40 years old. She attended school up to the secondary level. She is in a common-law marriage, and she has a daughter who is in primary school. She sells shoes through catalog sales. She is applying for her loan to buy tennis shoes and men's and women's shoes to fill her orders. She began the business three years ago. They offered her the opportunity to sell shoes through catalog sales, and they taught her how to sell. She goes out to offer her products to her neighbors in the community. Her business is important because she is earning money, and she likes to sell. She is proud of her business, which helps her buy food or whatever is needed at home. Her customers are young women, married women, and teachers. Her business is popular because they already know her. She is happy to have this opportunity because the loan that she will receive is going to be used to buy shoes and give her customers better service. Her dreams and hope are that her business will grow and she can raise her daughter so that she does not lack for anything and can continue going to school. The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "Thank you for the loans,  we hope to grow our businesses, and thank you for having confidence in us."

loans.use: to buy tennis shoes and shoes for ladies, men, and children

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 46 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente María no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace mas de cinco años, María trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de artículos para el hogar, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por la variedad de productos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
María se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como ollas, tinas, tapers, cucharas, platos, termos, entre otros artículos; de esta manera María tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que poco a poco pueda lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is a 46-year-old woman from the city of Pisco. She lives with her two children whom she loves dearly and who are all she lives for. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person with a strong desire to succeed. Unfortunately, María was not able to study for a professional career, as, from a very young age, he had to work to help his parents with the household expenses. In her free time she likes to spend pleasant moments with her family. 

For over five years, María has worked with effort and commitment in her little household goods shop. She begins in the very early hours of the morning and can work for about 8 hours. She believes that she does well because of the variety of goods she offers and the friendly way in which she deals with customers. 

María is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since their help will enable her to buy merchandise, such as pans, tubs, tupperware containers, spoons, plates, vacuum flasks, amongst other things. This will mean that María can improve the condition of her shop and, hopefully, boost her sales. This increased income will prove tremendously useful as she gradually works toward achieving her great dream of completing building work on her house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as pans, tubs, tupperware containers, spoons, plates, vacuum flasks, etc.

loans.name: Sophoun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sophoun is 27 years old and married with two children. She earns a living through farming rice to feed and support her family members. Sometimes, her husband works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn about KHR42,000 per day and manage to save about KHR27,000 each day for the future needs. 
Sophoun is the sixth cycled client with VisionFund and she completely paid back the past loans. She smartly used the loans to make her living gradually improved. Now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to make more rice so as to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Simiton

texts.en: Simiton is a Maasai by tribe and they are famous for beadwork and cattle keeping. She was born 33 years ago in Isinya near the border of Kenya and Tanzania. She is married to a hard working and enlightened man who allowed her to do business unlike others who think that Women should not live home for any activity. She sells items made out of beads at Nairobi Maasai market and in Isinya Town. Her husband sells milk and when her business is low then, she helps her husband in buying and immediate selling of milk. Working together has helped them greatly in building a strong family and in sharing responsibilities. Their children are still young; two are in primary where as the other two are still very young for school. So far, they can afford to have good meals, medical care and send their children to school from the proceeds of their businesses. They hope the situation will be better as the country’s economy improves such that the price of milk in rural areas can increase from 28cents to 42 cents like in other Towns.

loans.use: Simiton wants to buy beads, belts, bags and other materials, which act as, base material where beads are attached.

loans.name: Toaiva

texts.en: Toaiva is a single 25 year old lady. She is from a family of six; her parents, 2 brothers and one sister. Toaiva is the youngest in the family and the only child staying with her parents. All of her brothers and sister have moved to stay with their wives and husbands. Toaiva has always helped out her father with his plantation, and so her father had faith in her and passed on his business to her. Toaiva now runs the farm with help from her boyfriend. She’s really enjoying running the business, aiming to keep the business growing to get good money to build a nice house for her parents, and maybe finance her dream wedding day.

loans.use: Buy organic fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Vaimoana

texts.en: Vaimoana is one of the business ladies in the program that has attained the second level of business ranking. Her husband works, but his wages are not enough for the family's needs. Vaimoana is talented at sewing and designing clothes which she sells at the flea market along with traditional Samoan handbags she makes herself, coconut shell earrings and other handicrafts. She works at the flea market six days a week, and her income helps support her family. Most of her customers are local people and tourists. She is requesting a loan so she can offer more items to sell and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase materials for sewing: thread, neddles, scissors, paint

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de seats for bicycles, brake cables, balance wheels, rims and tires

loans.name: Nidia

texts.en:
Nidia is 44 years old, single and has a son. She studied hairstyling and got her certificate a year later. Her salon is located in the populous Cabañas de Caacupé neighborhood and she has been working for 15 years. She has an established clientele, mostly government workers who visit her salon to get manicures, pedicures, haircuts and hair coloring.

Her greatest accomplishment, thanks to her hard work and with her brother's help, is that she was able to become successfully self employed, opening her own salon and obtaining the training required to provide great service. This enabled her to expand her clientele and become well known in the neighborhood.

She needs a loan in the amount of $250 to buy beauty products, such as hair coloring, shampoo, conditioners, hair spray, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Nidia tiene 44 años, ella es soltera, tiene 1 hijo, estudió peluquería y se recibió como profesional 1 año después, su salón está ubicado en un barrio muy populoso de la compañía Cabañas de Caacupé, y ejerce el oficio hace más de 15 años, posee clientela formada y la mayoría son funcionarias públicas quienes le solicitan los servicios de de manicura, pedicuro, tintes, peinados, etc.

Su mayor logro es de que gracias a su esfuerzo, y la ayuda de su hermano pudo obtener la independencia laboral, habilitando su salón propio, y adquiriendo los elementos necesarios para realizar los servicios más exigentes, esto le facilitó aumentar su clientela y hacerse conocer en el barrio.

Desea el crédito para comprar productos de belleza como tintes para cabellos, shampoo, cremas, fijador de pelo, etc. el monto solicitado es de $ 250.

loans.use: To purchase hair coloring, condtioners and shampoos

loans.name: Manso

texts.en: Manso is 35 years old and is the father of four children.  He started his business three years ago and since then he has been accessing loans from SMT.  He owns 8 machines that process peanut butter and cassava leaves in the Kabala market in Sierra Leone.  With his previous loans Manso purchased 4 additional machines and hired 4 youths to assist in the business.  He would like to purchase 2 more machines and bags of peanuts with the loan. He would also like to diversify his business by including sesame, rice and palm oil. For these purposes, he is requesting a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: Diversify and expand his business to increase productivity.

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad M.  is a 47-year-old farmer who owns his small business in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Imishli region. He lives with his four children and wife. 
Mahammad has fifteen years of experience in animal breeding. Currently Mahammad has two calves, which he will sell soon . He sells calves for meat production to the local bazaar traders and to the Baku (the capital city), traders. He is the one person who works in their family. His wife look safter children and the  kids are too small to help Mahammad. 
Life in small region is getting harder and there is much competition in this business. Mahammad works very hard to cover the family needs, but to keep 5 members of a family  in good condition, owning two calves is not enough. Also October-December are the wedding months in Azerbaijan and Mahammad wishes to have more cattle than he has now. And this wish is possible. That’s why he has applied for 900 USD with a repayment term 15 month to purchase three additional calves. The estimated cost for one calf is 300 USD.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim was born in 1959. He has been in the dairy business for seven years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Armenian-occupied Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan and is settled in the Fuzuli region, in Kayidish village, which was built for IDPs. Rasim is married and has three children. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy a cow to help improve his business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Elia

texts.es:
Mrs. Elia is a 43 year-old single mother with a 9 year-old son named Juan Carlos who is the light of her life and the inspiration for her progress. Elia has been dedicated to the tailoring of suits, linen and other garments. It is sad for her to be alone with her son and therefore she spends as much time as possible to dressmaking in order to forget about this sad episode of her life and to be able to support her economic needs. Thanks to her skill and ability in the textile field, she worked at a very well-known store in the area, but this caused negligence toward her young son and now she has opened her own sewing workshop at home and it has been very successful as she has a good clientele. Doña Elia wishes to establish her own textile enterprise to live in peace without worries and she needs investment capital to put this into effect. Let us support this talented and hard-working mother to keep on working arduously to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elia de 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un pequeño hijo de 09 años de edad de nombre Juan Carlos, que se ha convertido en la luz de su vida y le ha devuelto las ganas de progresar. Elia desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica al arte textil en la confección de trajes, lencerías y otros, para ella es muy triste estar sola con su hijo, es por eso que se dedica el mayor tiempo posible a la costura con el afán de olvidar este triste episodio de su vida y sustentar sus necesidades económicas, gracias a su destreza y a sus habilidades en este campo textil trabajó en una tienda muy conocida en la zona, pero eso causaba el descuido de su pequeño hijo, ahora abrió su propia textilería en casa y la está aprovechando al máximo ya que tiene una buena clientela.Para la señora Elia el único interés para vivir tranquila sin preocupaciones es formar su propia empresa textil y para ello necesita un capital de inversión para su implementación. Apoyemos a esta madre que con talento y esfuerzo sigue trabajando arduamente por progresar.

loans.use: Capital to start a sewing workshop.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
I have a junk yard with cars that can no longer be fixed. I sell the parts that are still in good condition. This business is my family's source of income. I lack parts pertaining to more recent car models. I ask for a loan of $800 USD to buy more car parts.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo un yonque de carro que ya no tienes compostura y les vendo las piezas que están en buenas condiciones. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia. En el negocio me esta haciendo falta mas piezas de carros de modelos mas recientes. Solicito un préstamo de $800.00 Dlls para la comprar de piezas de carros.

loans.use: Purchase car parts

loans.name: Taga 2 Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
For these 5 women of Taga 2 on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD.  They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee.  Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Lauesi F., 34, is married with 4 children.  She wishes to start a business in sewing.  With her loan, she will purchase a sewing machine, thread, and materials to make t-shirts and puletasis (dresses) to be sold 2 times a week at the market.  

Maele P., 28, is married to a planter.  Minesi M., 32, is married with 3 children.  Uaima L., 35, is married with 6 children.  Vagatai L., 48, is divorced with 8 children.  With their loans, they will each purchase a weed killing sprayer, chemicals, bush knives and other equipment to cultivate and sell taro and bananas, staples of the Samoan diet.

loans.use: Purchase a weed killing sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, etc...

loans.name: Agness's Mwamko Group

texts.en:
Agness is 35 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 16 and 13 years old. Agness owns a small shop, which she started in 2007. Every day she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (clothes and bags) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in used clothes sales, charcoal sales and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items (clothes and bags) for her shop.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Mrs. Rama M. lives in the town of Thecho with her husband and their two sons. Both sons are in school, one in grade seven and the other in grade five.

Mrs. Rama and her husband Mr. Surendra earn a living making statues of traditional gods and idols, and demand for their products is increasing. To meet this increased customer demand, they need to invest in their business. They have applied for a $225 loan, which they will use to buy raw materials like wax, silver and bronze.

loans.use: to buy wax, silver, bronze and other materials needed to make religious statues.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: Pheng C., age 52, is a mother of seven children and works selling fish in a busy market. She earns approximately $4 per day. Her husband owns a plot of farmland, and he's been planting a variety of vegetables and rice since 1990. Three of the children are married and live away from home; two are employed and the other help with the father’s work. Now because of the difficulty of a dry season, Mrs. Pheng’s husband would like to purchase a water pump to irrigate the crops. The leftover will be used to increase the number of fish to resell for additional profit.  (Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Pheng C. was not available)

loans.use: To purchase a water pump to irrigate their crops in a dry season

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
Lola S. is 32 years old. She’s married and the loving mother of two children. Lola sells clothing for kids and shoes for men in the local market. She has been in this business for 6 years. Her husband also is a market vendor and he has another stall at the same market.

Like any mother Lola wants her children to have everything they need now and dreams that all of them shall have a higher education. Considering that such goods as clothes and shoes are in demand regardless the season of the year, Lola's business is rather stable, generating considerable income and allowing Lola to support her family.

Now Lola needs to increase her working capital so as to be able to purchase new summer clothes for kids and shoes for men for re-sale. For this purpose, she is requesting US$ 600 for a term of 6 months. Lola thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate in the loan repayment.

loans.use: Increasing working capital to purchase new clothing and shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. A. is divorced and has 6 children. She has never received schooling. Ama sells kenkey, which she prepares with corn. It is one of the most eaten foods in Ghana; she has done this business over 20 years. Ama uses her income to pay for her children's school fees. Ama will use the loan to purchase bags of corn for the production of the kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to build a family house.

loans.use: Ama will use the loan to purchase bags of corn for the production of kenkey.

loans.name: Ni Kadek Sudarmi

texts.id: Walaupun sebagai istri seorang sopir bus, tapi Kadek Sudarmi juga tetap berusaha membantu suaminya untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya. Sudarmi memelihara babi dengan modal awal Rp. 1.000.000,-. Sudarmi membeli bibit babi untuk dipelihara sebagai penggemukan. Sudarmi memelihara babinya selama 6 bulan, dan laku terjual perekor dari harga Rp. 800.000,- sampai Rp.1.000.000,- . Keuntungan yang diperoleh perekor sebanyak Rp. 80.000,- setelah dikurangi biaya pakan. Selain memberi dedak padi dan dedak gandum, Sudarmi juga memberi makan daun-daunan seperti daun pisang, daun talas dan batang pisang. Sebelum diberi makan babinya dimandikan dahulu sampai bersih dan kandangnya juga dibersihkan. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya dan juga untuk membiayai pendidikan anak-anaknya yang masih sekolah. Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dengan bangunan yang cukup permanen. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari Sudarmi dapat menambah jumlah babinya dan sisanya untuk membeli pakan ternaknya.
texts.en:
Kadek Sudarmi is a housewife. Her husband is a bus driver. She is helping her family by raising pig. Her initial capital IDR 1 million (around USD 107) which she spent for a breeding pig. She can sell all the piglets from this breeding pig for IDR 800 thousand to IDR 1 million where she can earn a profit of IDR 80 thousand (USD 9) per piglet.

She hopes to get the loan money to be able to add the number of piglets.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig foods (Membeli anak babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Déla

texts.fr: Mme Déla K. est née en 1976 à Kpévégo au sud du Togo  Elle mariée a un cultivateur avec lequel elle a eu (5) enfants  pour aider son marie à subvenir aux charges de la famille, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce notamment dans la vente des denrées  alimentaires. Elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner en marchandise et augmenter son revenu.
texts.en:
Ms. Déla K. was born in 1976 in Kpévégo, in the south of Togo. She is married to a grower, with whom she has five children. To assist her husband in providing for the family, she got started in commerce, notably in selling grocery items. She is requesting financing to get supplies of merchandise and to increase her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies of goods

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es:
Odilia es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco II que significa Corazón de Oro en quechua.
Odilia es casada, tiene 44 años y 7 hijos,  Odilia viaja todas las semanas a la ciudad de Pisco que se ubica a 6 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende quesos, papa, cereales, panes típicos, sus productos los compra en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y de Pisco en algunas oportunidades compra choclo que vende en los mercados de Ayacucho.
Odilia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos, panes.
Los sueños de Odilia son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Odilia is a member of the Communal Ccori Soncco II Bank, which means Heart of Gold in Quechuan. Odilia is 44 years old, and is married with 7 children. Odilia travels every week to the city of Pisco which is located 6 hours from the city of Ayacucho where she sells cheese, potatoes, cereals, and traditional breads. She buys her supply of products in the cities of Ayacucho and Pisco and occasionally buys corn for sale in the markets of Ayacucho. Odilia needs a loan of $325 that will be invested in the purchase of cheese and grains. Odilia dreams of providing a good education for her children and bettering her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Odilia needs a loan of $325 that will be invested in the purchase of cheese and grains.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
En el Mercado Iván Montenegro de la ciudad de Managua el señor Iván A. se dedica a laborar arduamente en su negocio de venta de queso el cual comercializa muy esforzadamente desde hace varios años.

Anteriormente él había tenido créditos con Ceprodel el cual le habían ayudado grandemente porque había adquirido los productos lácteos. Hoy en día una vez más ha solicitado créditos para la compra de los productos lácteos y espera que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar con su negocio en el mercado Iván Montenegro de la ciudad de Managua.
texts.en:
Iván A. works hard at his cheese-selling business in the Iván Montenegro market in Managua. He has worked hard at this business for several years. He has had previous loans from Ceprodel which have helped him greatly, in allowing him to buy milk products. Today, once again, he is asking for a loan to buy milk products and he is hoping that his loan will be approved so that he can continue his business in the Iván Montenegro market in the city of Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for cheese making

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.es:
Perfecta es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino. Perfecta es conviviente tiene 54 años y once hijos de 38, 36, 34, 33, 30, 28, 24, 22, 20, 14 y 12 años estos dos ultimaos están en la escuela 
Su esposo le compro una careta para que venda tamales, los compraba a 0.30 céntimos y los vendía a 0.50 céntimos, actualmente sus hijos preparan  tamales les venden el sábado y domingo al lado de una panadería.

Perfecta, desde que esta en Finca sus hijos se han involucrado en el  negocio y han comprado otra carreta que la ponen  afuera un  colegio, tiene mayores ingresos  lamentablemente no cuenta con la ayuda económica de su esposo por  que le gusta tomar  y andar con mujeres, necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, para compra de gaseosa y productos para preparar tamales 
El sueño de Perfecta es empezar a vender gaseosas, marciano, gelatina, tener un terreno propio, ella vive en casa de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Perfecta is partner of the Communal Bank called Niño Divino. Perfecta is 54 years and lives with her partner and 11 children who are 38, 36, 34, 33, 30, 28, 24, 22, 20, 14 and 12-year old. The last two are still in school. Her husband bought her a vending cart so she can sell tamales. She would buy them for 0.30 cents and sell them for 0.50 cents, at present her children prepare the tamales and she sell them on Saturday and Sunday next to a baker's. Since Perfecta joined Finca (Kiva's field partner) her children have got involved in the business and now they have bought another vending cart that they park outside a school. She has a bigger income but unfortunately she doesn't have the financial support of her husband who likes to drink and go out with other women. She needs a loan of 400 suns ($400) to buy soda drinks and food products to prepare the tamales. Her dream is to start selling sodas, shaved ice treats, jelly and one day have her own lot, she lives in house of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soda drinks and products to prepare tamales.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Married with three children, 33-year-old Leticia W. lives with her family in a rented apartment in Bawjiase, a suburb of Accra, the capital city of Ghana. Her husband is a trader in used clothes, while Leticia has been selling cosmetics and jewelry for the past four years.

Cosmetics sales are a lucrative source of income, and her experience in the community market has earned her many loyal customers. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of cosmetics and jewelry in order to enhance her income, thus allowing her to better contribute to the support of the family. Leticia is a member of Anointed Ladies Group, whose members provide assistance to one another in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales nucléaires  dans la ville de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro république du Mali.  
Par des liens professionnel, et de voisinage elles se sont  connues et exercent la même activité à savoir la restauration.
 Dans l’objectif de mieux rentabiliser leur activité, en faisant des achats en gros, elles ont intégré l’institution  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles  sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire. Les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt,  1 tonne  de riz, 100kg d’oignons, 20 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi et une grande quantité de condiments divers. Les produits sont achetés avec les grossistes de Dioïla et sont utilisés dans la restauration. Elles font  toutes sortes plats alimentaires qui sont appréciés par la clientèle composée d’employés de commerce du marché, des manœuvres, des chauffeurs et de voyageurs. 
Elles envisagent réaliser avec ce prêt 40 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune qui sera utilisé pour aider les époux à subvenir aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The members of the group Danaya average 28 years of age and 2 children. They live in nuclear conjugal families in the village of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali. They know one another by community and profession ties, and they do the same work, namely food catering.

With the goal of make their business more profitable by buying in bulk, they have joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their tenth solidarity loan. The preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The group members plan to use this loan to buy: 1 tonne of rice, 100 kg of onions, 20 packets (100-count each) of Maggi bouillon cubes, and a large quantity of various condiments. The goods are purchased from wholesalers in Dioïla and are used in preparing meals of all sorts, which are appreciated by customers composed of marketplace personnel, laborers, drivers, and travelers.

With this loan, the group members each envision realizing a profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to help their spouses to cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food catering

loans.name: Komlavi

texts.fr: Monsieur komlan kouwoada habite adidogomé, un quartier de la ville de lomé, il est marié avec 04 personnes à charges, sa femme est une revendeuse. L’activité qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille est la vente de ventilos, verres, montres et des fleurs, il fait ce commerce depuis 1994 dans sa propre boutique qu’il a appelé Ets K&K. il sollicite afin d’augmenter son stock un crédit pour l’achat de ventilos, fleurs, verres et montres
texts.en:
Mr. Komlan Kouwoada lives in Adidogomé, a district of the city of Lomé. He is married and has four people to support. His wife is a retailer. The work enabling him to provide for his family involves selling electric fans, drinking glasses, wristwatches, and flowers. He has been in this business since 1994 in his own shop, which he calls “Ets K&K”. He’s requesting a loan to augment his inventory by buying fans, flowers, glasses, and watches.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electric fans, drinking glasses, wristwatches

loans.name: Analida

texts.es:
La cliente tiene 22 años de edad.  Ella es soltera con un hijo de 2 años de edad de nombre Bruno Valentin.

La joven Analida termino el colegio y por su fuerza de voluntad de seguir adelante monto un pequeño negocio de venta de articulos de regalos y merceria con la cual actualmente mantiene a su pequeño hijo. 
Actualmente ya posee varios clientes formados, pues es la unica que posee un negocio de regalos en la zona donde vive. 

Analida viaja una vez por semana a la ciudad capital para realizar compras para su negocio y de esta manera tener más mercaderias que atraigan la atensión de sus clientes. Tiene pensado estudiar peluqueria para de esta manera complementar su negocio y de esta manera tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
The client is 22 years old. She is single and has a 2 year old son named of Bruno Valentin. The young Analida finished school and through her strong will to move ahead started a small business selling gifts and notions, this way she supports her small son. She currently has several steady customers, since she is the only one that has a gift store in the area where she lives. Analida travels to the capital city once a week to purchase items for her business, this way she has more merchandise that attracts the attention of her customers. She is thinking of studying hairdressing so that she can complement her business and this way have more income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bookstore items (notebook, pencils, erasers, ruler, calculator, clips, stationary, paper pads)

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 48 años, es madre de dos hijos que ya tienen sus propias familias y viven lejos de ella. Sin embargo, tiene a su lado, a su esposo, quien es trabajador dependiente y la apoya mucho. Ella tiene una panadería en las instalaciones de su casa, cuenta con maestro panadero quien se encarga de hacer las variedades de panes, este negocio viene funcionando hace 5 años y le va muy bien. La ventaja es que al quedarse sólo su esposo y ella, los gastos son menores y pueden vivir cómoda y tranquilamente. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que muchas personas, de distintos lugares, acuden a comprar sus panes por ser deliciosos y de buena calidad, lo que refuerza le rentabilidad de su panadería, además se encuentra ubicada en un lugar comercialmente estratégico. Para más adelante, Maria quiere tener una heladería que se complemente con la elaboración de postres en su panadería. Con MFP, ya tiene 9 préstamos y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque sus compañeros son unidos y existe mucha comprensión entre todos. Maria invertirá el dinero que solicita en su panadería, comprando los ingredientes e insumos básicos para la elaboración de sus panes y postres.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old and a mother of two children, both of whom have their own families and live far away from her. Nonetheless, her husband, who works as a sales clerk, is by her side and helps support her. She has a bakery on the premises of her house where she bakes a variety of breads. She has been running her business for 5 years and has been very successful. One advantage of only having to support herself and her husband is that there are much fewer expenses and they are able to live a comfortable and tranquil life. One thing she likes about her business is that many people come from various places to purchase her bread for its good quality and delicious taste. The high quality of her breads and her strategic location help to ensure the profitability of her bakery. In the future, Maria would like to have an ice cream shop to compliment the pastries in her bakery. She has had 9 loans through MFP and she likes to work with her communal bank because there is a sense of unity and understanding amongst her colleagues. Maria will invest the money from the loan in her bakery and use the money to purchase ingredients and raw materials to make her breads and pastries.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and raw materials for her bakery.

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.es:
La señora María Jesús R. C. tiene 34 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Unión y Esfuerzo y vive en el caserío Túpac Amaru del distrito de Carabamba en la provincia de Julcán en  el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió primer grado de primaria pero ya no continuó debido a la falta de apoyo económico de sus padres.  Se casó a los 24 años y actualmente tiene dos hijos, los cuales dependen de ella económicamente.
María Jesús compra y vende cuajada para hacer queso (insumo para la elaboración de queso).
Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles, el cual fue cancelado en 4 cuotas, dicho dinero fue invirtido en compra de cuajada.
Con este crédito de 600 que será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en la compra de más cuajada y otros insumos para la elaboración de queso.
María sueña con ver a sus hijos profesionales y felices.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Jesús R. C., 34, belongs to the Unión y Esfuerzo community bank. She lives in the Túpac Amaru village, Carabamba district, Julcán province, La Libertad department, Perú. She went to first grade, but her parents did not have the economic resources for her to continue. She married at 24, and she has two children who are economically dependent upon her. María Jesús buys and sells curd, an ingredient in making cheese. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which was repaid in four payments, she bought curd. With this loan for 600 PEN, which will be repaid in four payments, she will buy more curd and other ingredients for making cheese. María’s dream is to see her children happy and that they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy curd and other ingredients for making cheese.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Héctor es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres del Dos Mil.
Héctor es soltero, tiene 45 años, no tiene hijos. 
Héctor  administrar una bodega que sus padres le heredaron, el trabaja todos los días.
Héctor  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de mercadería, arroz, azúcar, leche, cerveza. 
Desde que Héctor esta en Finca, aprendió a invertir, es una gran ayuda para invertir en el negocio.  
El sueño de Héctor es poner un minimarket
texts.en:
Hector is a member of the Mujeres del Dos Mil Village Bank. He's 45, single, and does not have any children. He runs the grocery store that he inherited from his parent, and he works every single day. He is seeking a loan of 1000 soles to buy merchandise, including rice, sugar, milk, and beer. Hector has learned how to invest since he's been with FINCA. They've been a big help with respect to investing in his business. Hector's dream is to have a mini market.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, including rice, sugar, milk, and beer.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: N. Christine est née vers 1964 à Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Christine est mariée à Michel ADJAGBE, un pêcheur.  Christine est mère de trois (3) enfants tous scolarisés: Bonaventure, Ulrich et Romuald. Christine et sa famille habitent à Zogbo un quartier de Cotonou. Christine n'est jamais allée à l'école. Depuis son enfance, Christine a été initiée à la vente de crevettes fumées et poissons frais. C’est cette activité que Christine continue d’exercer à ce jour. Christine vend ses produits en gros à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Mais par moment certains des clients de Christine passent chez elle à la maison pour faire leurs achats. Christine a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de ALIDé  pour son activité et  elle a bien remboursé ce crédit. Christine est satisfaite du premier crédit de ALIDé, elle espère toujours bénéficier des prestations de ALIDé pour consolider son activité. En effet, Christine sollicite son second crédit  de ALIDé pour s'approvisionner davantage en crevettes fraîches.
texts.en:
N. Christine was born around 1964 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to Michel ADJAGBE, a fisherman, and is the mother of three children, Bonaventure, Ulrich, and Romuald, who are all in school. Christine and her family live in Zogbo, a district of Cotonou. She never went to school. Since her childhood, she has been initiated in selling smoked shrimp and fresh fish. This has been her business to this day. She sells her products wholesale at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. But at times, certain of her customers come by her house to make their purchases. Christine has already benefited from an Alidé loan and is happy with the first loan. She now hopes to benefit from Alidé services to consolidate her business. To this end, she’s requesting her second loan with Alidé for added supplies of fresh shrimp.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 30 baskets of fresh shrimp

loans.name: Candelaria Cristina

texts.es: La señorita Candelaria Cristina es originaria de la comunidad de Patzarajmac Totonicapan ha 8 kilomestro de la cabecera departamental  su principal fuente de ingreso es el bordado manual dicha actiuvidad  lo aprendio cuando ella tenia diez años que dicho trabajo necesita tener mucha paciencia ya que para elaborar un Güipil necesita de Mucho tiempo por el tipo de figura hoy necesita el apoyo de la institución para un credito que lo inveritara para la compra de materiales y moldes ya que ha conseguido dos  nuevas trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Candelaria Cristina is from the Patzarajmac Totonicapan community, which is eight kilometers from the head of the department. Her primary source of income is from hand embroidery. She learned how to do this when she was ten years old. You need lots of patience for this work. It takes a lot of time to make a Güipil (top blouse of the indigenous Mayan outfit) because of its shape. She now needs a loan from the institution to buy materials and patterns, and she has two new workers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Kaswa North Namwase Maria Group

texts.en: N. Maria is the group leader of Kaswa north. She is a married woman forty-five years of age, blessed with ten children, the youngest of whom is still going to school. She is also looking after two siblings. She has been in the business of selling used clothes for over fifteen years. She is using the loan to purchase used clothing, normally consisting of skirts, tops, and gentlemen's clothing to sell to customers. She is adding capital to her business, whereby, now that it is doing well, she is able to purchase used clothing in bigger volumes. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: Purchasing used clothing, like skirts, tops, and men's clothing

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
La señora Bacilia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Juleñita”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Juli, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 60 años D. edad, D. estado civil Casada, tiene 8 hijos (todos con familia) ella es no letrada, vive en el Barrio 3 D. Junio  Jr. Ilave.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 2 años,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles,  el cual utilizó para la compra D. combustible (kerosene). 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 400.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. combustible (kerosene) para venderlo por litros, además ella tiene un negocio D. venta D. golosinas.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Señora Bacilia belongs to the La Juleñita Communal Bank which is located in the Juli District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 60 years of age, in a civil marriage, and has eight children who all have their own families. She is not literate and lives on Jirón Ilave in Barrio 3 D. Junio. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years. She used her initial loan of 300 New Sols to buy fuel (kerosene). At this time she needs a loan of 400 New Sols to buy kerosene fuel in order to sell it by the liter. She also has a business selling sweets. Her wish is to continue working. She enjoys the savings plan and the punctuality in the (Bank) meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kerosene fuel.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy e es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No seas Flojo en quechua.
Nancy es soltera, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Nancy tiene un restaurante - polleria llamada Mayela en un local alquilado ubicado en una avenida céntrica, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 4 personas.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y leche.
Los sueños de Nancy son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener otra sucursal.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar y leche.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.en:
Raymundo is 58 years old. He is a resident of Barangay South Caronsi, Peñablanca, Cagayan. He is married to Ester, 47 years old.  They have five children: Reyna - 28, Emily - 23, Joyelon - 21, Remark – 19 and Norman – 16 years old. 

Raymundo is a local farmer and he manages a 1.5 hectares of corn field and at he is also engaged in the livestock business particularly goat raising. He used to wakes up early in the morning for his two businesses. 

He wanted to borrow loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP9, 000 for his goat raising business. The loan will be utilized in building goat house and some will be used to buy a piglet that he will also start to raise.  He is doing her best to earn good income for the benefit of her family.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Positivas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su tercer ciclo. El mismo consta de 15 integrantes que realizan distintos tipos de actividades comerciales para poder obtener ingresos extras para sus familias.

Las actividades que realizan son:

Elizabeth C.	Venta de hamburguesa
Graciela L.	
Ada O.	Venta de Avon
Juana C.	Vta  de Quiniela
Irma G.	Venta de Ropas

Beatriz B.	Venta de frutas 
Irma B.	Venta de comestible
Dionicia F.	Venta de empanadas
Silvina C.	Venta de ropas
Maria F.	Modista
Carmen A.	Vta de ropas
Canuta L.	Venta de Quiniela
Maria M.	Venta de Quiniela
Leopoldina Y.	Venta deAvon
Cinthia O.	Fotocopiadoras 


 Todas estas mujeres son un ejemplo de sacrificio. Podemos  citar como ejemplo a doña Juana C. de 65 años de edad, ella tiene 2 hijos que se quedan  en la casa mientras ella se  va a hacer su Quiniela (venta de loterías) por la mañana luego regresa a su casa prepara para el almuerzo  y vuelve a salir por la tarde para a hacer su quiniela.

Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar de su trabajo debe de realizar las tareas de la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante con sus hijos ya que es madre soltera.   
Tiene una casita  pequeña hecha de materiales precarios. De esta manera ella sostiene los gastos de la casa y de  sus dos hijos que van en la escuela.
texts.en:
The committee is currently in its third cycle. It consits of the same 15 members who are in different commercial activities to earn extra income for their families. The activities they do are: Elizabeth C. – Hamburger sales Graciela L. Ada O. –Avon sales Juana C. - Lottery sales Irma G. –Clothing sales Beatriz B. – Fruit sales Irma B. – Grocery sales Dionicia F. –Empanada sales Silvina C. – Clothing sales Maria F. – Fashion designer Carmen A. – Clothing sales Canuta L. –Lottery sales Maria M. – Lottery sales Leopoldina Y. – Avon sales Cinthia O. – Photocopiers

All of these women provide an example of sacrifice. We can site, as an example, Juana C., 65 years old. She has two children that stay at home while she does her lottery sales in the morning. Later, she returns home to prepare lunch and then goes out again in the afternoon to do more lottery sales.

This is a hard-working woman who has a burdensome day to day life, because upon returning from work she has to do the housework, and everything she does is for the future well-being of her children as a single mother. She has a small home made of unstable materials. In this way, she can keep up with the costs of her house and her children who go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as groceries, lottery, make-up, lotions, clothing, etc...

loans.name: Henry Norberto

texts.es: El joven Henry M. de 23 años de edad, es técnico en electricidad industrial, tiene 18 meses de estar laborando en su oficio ya que cuando comenzó lo hico como conductor ya que tenia que llevar ingresos a su familia, su esposa y dos hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad, vive en el barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, espera alcanzar estabilidad laborar un mejor ingreso para poder cumplir sus metas, este es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprara cerámica para poner en la sala y dar mejor comodidad a su familia. Espera pagar en tiempo y forma para poder en el futuro seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Henry M. is a 23 years old electrician. He has been working his trade for 18 months in order to support his family, a wife and two children ages 4 and 6. He lives in the “Hialeah” neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. He hopes to develop steady work and a better income in order to reach his goals. This will be his third loan through Afodenic (Kiva field partner), with which he will buy some pottery for his living room in order make his family more comfortable. He expects to repay in time so that he can continue to improve his home in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buys pottery for his living room

loans.name: Janilda

texts.en:
Janilda T. is from the village of San Vicente. She is 42 years old. Janilda is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Janilda owns and operates a snack-vending business, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Janilda has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Janilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janilda is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Janilda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

* Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn M. is from the village of Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community.  Merlyn is just starting this business. Previously she had a trisikad to transport passengers in their village (a "pedicab" or bicycle with a side-attached rider seat),

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This  will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Rosally

texts.en:
Rosally D. C., 23, is one of the youngest entrepreneurs in Pasay City.  She is married to Roberto, a 25 year old seafarer.  They don't have children, yet.

Rosally sells fresh dressed chickens, fruit (bananas) and coconuts and been in business for six years.  She has a stall in Baclaran – a commercial district between the cities of Parañaque and Pasay.  Rosally has a hired hand so she can attend to her growing number of customers.  Rosally earns a net income of P26,000 a month.  

Rosally has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative for two years now.  She has just finished repaying a previous loan on P30,000 and was very punctual in all of her payments.  Now, she is applying for a new P32,000 loan to buy additional merchandise.

She hopes to embark into other viable businesses soon.  Rosally dreams of owning a house and lot. 
----------------------------------------------
About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Juan Bautista Group

texts.es: Una de las características de la banca comunal “Juan Bautista” esta representada por la señora Carmen y conformada por 13 miembros que van cursando juntos su segundo ciclo demostrando capacidad para administrar sus fondos, unidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Entre las actividades que desarrollan las socias del grupo esta la venta de pan, salteñas, dulces, sandalias, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, refrescos zapatos y al servicio de moto taxi de recojo y entrega. La competencia con respecto a sus negocios es difícil cada día para ellas, ya que  tienen que trabajar muy duro para poder sacar adelante sus negocios. El crédito esta destinado a la compra de mercadería navideña para esta época ya que la demanda es alta y necesitan cambiar de rubro para tener un mejor ingreso. En este grupo solamente son 3 las personas que anteriormente han participado en grupos similares y la mayoría es la primera vez que participan de grupos solidarios pero ya van cursando su segundo ciclo sin mayor dificultad para sacar adelante a toda su familia.
texts.en:
One of the characteristics of the communal bank “Juan Bautista” that is represented by Señora Carmen and is formed by 13 members is that are going into their second loan cycle, demonstrating their capacity for managing their funds, their unity, and their responsibility in their payments. The different activities between the clients of the group is the sale of bread, crackers, sweets, sandals, neighborhood grocery stores, sodas, shoes and motor-taxi service for pickup and delivery. Everyday the competition with respect to their businesses is difficult so they have to work very hard so they can move forward with their businesses.

The credit will be used in the purchase of Christmas merchandise because in this season demand is high and they need to change areas in order to have higher income. In this group there are only 3 people that have participated in similar groups and for the majority, this is the first time that they have participated in solidarity groups. But already they are enrolling in their second cycle without much difficulty to take their whole family forward.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations capital

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en:
Sanita S., 52 years old, is a farmer. She is helping her husband till a 1-hectare farm to produce quality corn Sanita has been a farmer since 1982. The income she receives from the farm has benefited her family especially since it helps them pay their daily expenses and for things like food and clothing.  When she started to farm, Sanita joined also in the CEVI credit program. 

She would like to request another loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. In that way, she will be able to have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette D. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old. Janette is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Janette owns and operates a butcher shop, butchering and selling poultry meat in the market. Janette is just starting this business.

In 2009, Janette joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Janette is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to broaden her product offering. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to broaden her product offering

loans.name: Suh

texts.en: G. is married and has four children. She lives in the heart of metropolitan Bamenda, Cameroon. She plans to invest this loan in dressmaking and in the cultivation of yam and cassava.
