Specifically, she will purchase cloth for dressmaking, yam seedlings for her farm, and will pay for the clearing and hoeing of her farm in order to plant yam and cassava. Her yam and cassava farm is located outside the main town whereas her dressmaking workshop is in the town. G. has been a GHAPE member since 2008 and this is her second loan. Yam sells at a high price while cassava can be processed into many other products such as garri and waterfufu for marketing. G. is also a longtime fashion designer and has many customers. With the profits from this loan, G. plans to buy a piece of land for her family to construct a house on. She also plans to take care of her family, ensure that they eat well, and buy their medication. She knows she will be able to repay this loan because of the low interest rate and the small repayment installments. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO (non-governmental organization) based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, seedlings and to pay for clearing her farm

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Según su asesora de crédito, Miriam C. Q. es una mujer que “no se queda quieta”; ella es una comerciante, muy emprendedora y residente del barrio La Playa de Barranquilla, tiene 63 años y tres hijos entre las edades de 42 y 23 años. Su negocio consiste en la venta de varios tipos de mercancía que comercializa según la época del año. Con el crédito de $1.500.000 que ahora solicita quiere comprar  telas y accesorios –como escudos bordados- para uniformes de un colegio cercano.
Con el lema “de todo un poquito”, el negocio de Miriam abarca muchas cosas: Hace diez años vendía zapatos de colegio y hace siete adicionó helados y mercancías por catálogos. Ahora su negocio incluye la venta y elaboración de chichas -un tipo de bebida hecha de maíz o arroz- y de bolis -un helado típico de Colombia- y elaboración de artesanía en hilo tejidas,  o pintadas en tela y/o  con escarcha. También se dedica a vender mercancías  por catálogo o por encargo: calzados, accesorios para damas como aretes y bisutería y listas de libros. 
Se enteró de la Fundación por vecinos y recomendaciones hace cinco años y desde entonces ha tenido siete créditos. Cuida mucho su crédito y trata de participar en todos los programas de la Fundación, tanto en el programa de legalización con la Cámara de Comercio, como en actividades lúdicas, por ejemplo el bingo o paseos. Además, toma cursos para actualizar sus conocimientos para vender siempre lo que esté de moda. Considera que su vinculación a la Fundación ha sido positiva, puesto que se mantiene activa y útil y que ha podido obtener mucho de lo que necesita. Ahora sueña con terminar la casa donde vive con toda su familia.
texts.en:
According to her loan officer, Miriam C. Q. is a woman who “cannot keep still”. She is an enterprising businesswoman who lives in the neighborhood of La Playa in Barranquilla. She is 63 years old and has three children between the ages of 23 and 42. Miriam manages a business selling different types of merchandise based on the time of year. With the loan of 1,500,000 COP that she is requesting, she will buy fabrics and accessories (such as borders) for making uniforms for the local high school.

“Everything for less” is the slogan for Miriam’s business where she sells many things. For ten years, she sold school shoes and for seven years, she sold ice cream and catalog merchandise. Her business now includes the production and sale of “chicha”, a beverage made from corn or rice, and “bolis” (a traditional form of ice cream found in Colombia). She also makes handicrafts made of woven threads, painted fabrics, or frosted glass. In addition she sells merchandise through catalog or by request such as shoes, women’s accessories (earrings, costume jewelry, etc.), and reading material.

Miriam learned about the Foundation five years ago from neighbors and through other recommendations. Since then she has taken out seven loans. Miriam is very careful with her loans and tries to take advantage of all of the services offered by the Foundation, such as the licensing program provided through the Chamber of Commerce. She also enjoys fun activities, such as playing bingo or taking walks. The courses she has taken have updated her knowledge in selling products that are always in fashion. Miriam believes her working relationship with the Foundation has been a positive experience, so she remains active and tries to obtain as much as she can as long as the benefits are useful. She now dreams of finishing the home in which she lives with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & accessories for making school uniforms

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.en:
Amy D. is from the village of barangay Bagahabag, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Amy is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Amy D. group.

Amy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Amy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Amy has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Amy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. Amy is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Amy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional seed, seedlings & young crops to plant and grow

loans.name: Toan

texts.en: Mrs. T. has been married for about three years to Mr. Choun and they are blessed with two young kids who are not enrolled in school. T., 23, has been selling fresh fish since 2005 in the busy local market, earning approximately $3 each day. In addition, her husband works as a temporary laborer in the construction field. In order to generate extra profit and make business more successful, T. is applying for a loan to use as capital to improve her business financially.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith P. is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old. Judith is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling different vegetables and spices in the local community. Judith has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Judith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Judith from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 48 years old and married with three children. She knits sweaters, cushons, and clothing to earn a living. She learnt knitting from her mother and with her support she has been able to run this business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya her business has grown and her living standard has improved since she can access loans. She has also learnt to cut operating costs which has led to business growth. She has requested a loan of kes 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to her supply of yarn. Adding more yarn will help her meet her customers' demands and also increase her output. She hopes to grow her business and improve her living standard in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of yarn.

loans.name: Ollantay Ii Group

texts.es:
Gregoria, tiene 35 años, es conviviente, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Gregoria nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Ollantay II”  somos 13 integrantes (12 mujeres y 1 varón), la junta directiva está conformada por Juana Esther que es la presidente, Margarita que es la Tesorera, Ofelia que es la secretaria, Sofía que es la fiscal y las reuniones  son cada treinta días en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa y en esta oportunidad  me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio D. mi principal actividad económica.  

“Gregoria hace dos años que participa en el banco comunal Ollantay II la Unidad D. Micro finanzas D. la  Asociación Arariwa”.

Gregoria su principal actividad económica es la venta y compra D. papa pelada para las pollerías y restaurante, Gregorio requiere el préstamo para comprar papa. Ya son  5  años que trabaja en el negocio y le va muy bien. Su sueño D. la socia es tener su propia casa y sacar profesionales a sus hijos. 

La mayoría D. los socios son comerciantes por ejemplo  algunos se dedican a la bisutería, venta D. frutas, venta papa pelada,  venta D. comestibles, venta D. abarrotes, venta D. artesanía y otros socios brindan servicios como por ejemplo D. cobrador D. pasajes, profesora, etc. La mayoría D. los socios son puntuales y responsables con las cuotas.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 35 years old and lives with her partner and her three children in the city of Cusco. She tells us, "In my community bank 'Ollantay II', there are 13 members (12 women and one man), and the board of directors consists of Juana Esther as president, Magarita as the treasurer, Ofelia as the secretary, and Sofia as the finance advisor. The meetings are every 30 days at the central office of Asociación Arariwa. In this instance they have chosen me as the representative of the community bank to give my testimonial about my principal economic activity." Gregoria has been with the community bank for two years and she makes a living buying potatoes and selling them peeled to poultry shops and restaurants. She is requesting the loan to purchase potatoes. She has had the business for five years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have her own home and see her children become professionals. The majority of the community banks members are merchants. For example, some make a living in jewelry, others sell fruits, meals, groceries or craftwork, while others proviD. services as a parts collector, teacher, etc. The majority of the members are punctual and responsible with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes and other products

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.ru:
Исмаилова Айнура – лидер этой группы. Для Айнуры каждый будний день начинается с того, что она рано утром, доет своих коров и сдаёт молоко на продажу. Вот уже пятнадцать лет Айнура за счёт молока, зарабатывает около пяти тысяч сомов в месяц. Для Айнуры, у которой трое детей, это конечно же очень малые деньги, и поэтому все эти годы Айнура старалась искать себе дополнительный источник заработков. А именно, она помимо коров, держит ещё кое – какую живность: несколько овец и бычков. По мере необходимости, Айнура может выводить скотину на базар, продавать её и использовать деньги на повседневные или срочные нужды. У Айнуры сейчас ребёнок дошкольного возраста, и ей вскоре придётся увеличить расходы, и Айнура прекрасно это осознаёт. Поэтому она вместе с мужем, который имел издавна опыт в земледелии , решила параллельно заниматься выращиванием сельскохозяйственной продукции. Айнура приняла очень важное решение, так как последующее развитие дел показало значимость диверсификации источников заработка. Айнуре и её мужу удалось увеличить поголовье скота, отремонтировать дом и значительно улучшить свои жилищные условия. К тому же Айнура смело идёт на дело, зная, что всегда найдёт нужную поддержку со стороны мужа, который активно ей помогает по хозяйству и всегда рядом. Сейчас Айнура нуждается в кредите, чтобы вложить средства для обработки земли. 

Партнёры Айнуры по группе: 

Макишевой Айнуре тридцать восемь. Она замужем и у неё пятеро детей. Старшему сыну девятнадцать, а самому младшему сыну всего полтора года. Айнура держит скот и продаёт молоко, а её муж работает таксистом. Айнура с мужем с недавних пор занимаются также и выращиванием сельхоз продукции и теперь им нужен кредит, чтобы провести обработку земли.

Жоомартовой Динаре двадцать девять. Динара – мать троих детей. Муж Динары – работник правоохранительных органов. Сама же Динара предоставляет услуги парикмахера. Недавно Динара с мужем начали грандиозную постройку сарая. Сейчас им необходимо закупить стройматериалы, однако заработков Динары и её мужа не хватает. Они очень надеются на этот кредит. A

Абакирову Жолочу сорок четыре года. Он – отец пятерых детей. Для того, чтобы кормить семью он занимается перепродажей и откормом овец. Его жена работает на вино – водочном заводе. Трое детей школьного и дошкольного возраста, и поэтому Жолочу решил параллельно заниматься земледелием. Он надеется получить этот кредит для сельскохозяйственных работ. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Ainura I. is the leader of her group. Her day begins early in the morning, when she milks the cows and takes the milk for sale. For fifteen years the milk has provided her an income of around five thousand soms per month. This isn’t a whole lot of money considering the fact that she’s got three children, so for the past year she has been trying to find herself an additional source of income. Aside from the cattle, Ainura has all manner of poultry, and some sheep and bulls. If the need arises, she can take her cattle to the bazaar and sell them to get money for everyday needs or emergencies. She has a preschooler right now and she realizes that before long her expenses will go up, so, she and her husband, who has farming experience from way back, decided that they would raise crops, too. It was quite a significant decision because they were at the point of really needing to diversify their sources of income. Ainura and her husband have managed to expand their herd of cattle, fix up their house and substantially improve their living conditions. Ainura goes about her work gamely, too, knowing that she’ll always have the support she needs from her husband, who helps her diligently with the business and sticks by her side. She needs a loan at this time to get the items she needs for farming. Ainura’s partners in the group are: Ainura M. is thirty-eight, married, and has five children. Her eldest son is twenty and the youngest is only a year and a half old. She raises cattle and sells the milk. Her husband is a cab driver. Not long ago, she and her husband started raising crops and now they are in need of a loan so they can proceed to work their land. Dinara Z. is twenty-nine and the mother of three children. Her husband works in law-enforcement and she’s a hair stylist. Recently she and her husband began the huge undertaking of building a barn. Now they really need building materials, but their combined incomes don’t suffice. They really need the loan. Zholochu A. is forty-four-years-old and the father of five children. In order to feed his family he raises and sells sheep. His wife works at a vodka factory. Three of the children are preschool and school-aged, so Zholochu decided that he would farm, too. He hopes to receive this loan for his agricultural work.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to sow the land with agricultural products

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is currently in the business of selling bedsheets at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bedsheets to sell.  Rose is 39 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop as her point of sale.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bedsheets

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is aged 46 years, married, and has four children.  She deals in the sale of household products and conducts her business in a shopping centre near Nairobi town. Her clients are mainly mid-level income earners from the banana plantations. She has been in the same business for the past months. 

Lilian has applied for a loan which she intends to use to add more stock of household products and thus also increase the range of products. In future she intends to build a modern house after expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase stock of plastic containers, cooking pans and household utensils

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
A loving mother and member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Amelia is grateful for access to capital and other services, such as savings and insurance.  With the support of Kiva lenders, Amelia is hopeful that her business endeavor will provide steady income and improvements in her family’s quality of life to move out of poverty.

Amelia is a busy entrepreneur, managing her food production and selling the product in the local community. Her previous loan from Kiva has provided working capital to expand her business and purchase more ingredients for her food preparation. With the loan, Amelia has noticed that her monthly income has almost doubled since she has attracted new customers with additional inventory.

Amelia joined Kiva partner ASHI in 1997, attracted by ASHI's lower interest rates and range of loans for business, education and home repair. Prior to ASHI, Amelia had no access to capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams. Positive growth from her business has helped Amelia fund the education of her children. Since joining ASHI, Amelia has experienced positive changes in her life and she hopes her business will continue to flourish so she can provide long-term financial stability for her family.

Making and selling foods also contributes a good income for her family and that’s why, even if sometimes it is hard to do, she never gets tired of doing it. Therefore, she is now requesting another Kiva loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos to support the maintenance of her ventures. This will allow her to grow her  business further so that their children fulfill their dreams of completing college degrees and experience a life that’s full of happiness.

loans.use: To support the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Libia

texts.es: Libia tiene 23 años, vive en casa de su hermana en compañía de su madre y sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a vender prendas de vestir, ofreciendo a personas que en su mayoría son conocidas o familiares, eso le garantiza el pago de la mercadería que vende. Afirma que este negocio es muy rentable porque compra a un precio módico las prendas y puede ofrecer a un buen precio a sus clientes, es así que se abastece de mercadería cada 2 meses donde viaja a la ciudad de Lima y compra al por mayor. Una de sus metas es tener más capital y tener un puesto de ventas. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en casacas y prendas gruesas ya que son los que más demanda tiene en esta época de frío.
texts.en:
Libia is 23 years old and lives in her sister's house along with her mother and her two children. For the past two years she has worked selling clothing, mostly to family members and acquaintances. This helps her to be sure that she will be paid for her merchandise. Libia says that her business is very profitable because she can buy clothing for a low price and offer her customers a good price when she sells it. She stocks up on clothing every 2 months when she travels to the city of Lima, where she can purchase the clothing wholesale. One of her goals is to obtain more working capital and set up a sales stand. This is her fourth loan with MFP [the Kiva field partner]. She is very happy to have this financial support and has always repaid her loans on time. She also enjoys being a part of her communal bank because her fellow bank members are responsible and supportive. She thanks the people who will fund her loan. It will be very useful for her to move her business forward. She will use the loan money to buy more jackets and other heavy clothing that is in demand during the cold winter season in Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jackets and other cold-weather clothing for the winter season.

loans.name: Lester Modesto

texts.es:
El señor Lester Modesto M. R., es Comerciante se dedica a Venta de Muebles en el sector de el Bisne, ofrece a su clientela Roperos de 2 y 3 cuerpos, Juegos de sillas abuelitas, Comedor, Mesas, Camas de junco, Mil uso,  es casado no tienen hijos y el atiende personalmente su negocio, habita en el barrio  San Agustín, parte de su mercadería se la traen hasta acá y otra parte tiene que viajar a Managua a traerla.

El señor Lester M. lleva 3 créditos con ceprodel los cuales los han utilizado para ir aumentando su inventario y siempre ha pagado en tiempo y forma sus créditos, es muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Lester Modesto M. R. is a merchant who sells furniture in the Bisne sector. He sells two or three tier wardrobes (armoires); rocking chairs, dinette sets, tables, reed beds, etc. He is married and doesn’t have any children. He personally attends to his business and lives in the San Agustín neighborhood. Some of his merchandise is delivered to him and some he has to pick up in Managua. Lester has had three prior loans through CEPRODEL, which he has used to increase his inventory. He has always made his payments on time and he has been very responsible with his obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Aziipa's Group

texts.en:
Aziipa D. is the leader of this group. She is forty-four and married. She has seven children: three daughters and four sons. Her two elder sons work in Russia, her elder daughter is married and the others either go to school or are at home. Her husband breeds cattle. Aziipa sells maize. Twenty years ago, together with her husband, Aziipa bought a cow with the purpose of fattening and reselling it. They started with an initial investment of 5,000 KGS. During the next twenty years, they have significantly increased the number of cattle. She is applying for a loan in order to buy maize. Then she is planning to resell it at a higher price. They hope that their profits will allow them to move to cattle breeding only. 

Group members:

Shahra N. is the treasurer of the group. She is thirty-three and married. She has a son who is fifteen and goes to school. Her husband breeds cattle. She sells vegetables at the local market. In 2007, she decided to start selling vegetables in order to make money.  The first time she succeeded and then she increased her assortment. Starting with an initial investment of 1,000 KGS, she now makes about $110 monthly. She is planning to increase her assortment further in order to get higher profits and therefore she applied for a loan. With the profits from selling vegetables she is planning to give her son the opportunity to get his higher education abroad. 

Amangeldi S. is fifty-five and married. He has five children, all of whom live independently from their parents. His wife is a housewife. His youngest son helps him with the business. In 2005, he started buying and reselling cattle. He made a profit the first time and decided that it would be a profitable niche. Since that time, he buys and resells cattle. Now, he could greatly increase his number of cattle and therefore he is building another barn. He is applying for a loan because he wants to buy even more cattle and it would help him in increasing his number of cattle.

Anara Z. is twenty-six and married. She has two daughters who are six and five years old and are still at home. Her husband is a builder. Anara breeds cattle. Two years ago, she decided to buy cattle for breeding with the money received from selling vegetables from her own garden. She bought cattle for 15,000 KGS and she could significantly increase their numbers afterward. She is applying for a loan in order to buy cattle for breeding and increasing their numbers. She wants to expand her business as much as possible. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase maize

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbold, 40, is a widower whose wife died in 2002 of liver cancer. He lives with his only daughter, Dulguun, 19, in Ulaanbaatar city, the capital of Mongolia. Dulguun is on her way to becoming a doctor and studies in medical college in second grade.

Enkhbold has been running a taxi business since 2003 and it is his only source of income. He owns a small piece of land and a family house.

Each year, Enkhbold has to pay 1 million Mongolian tugriks (approximately 750 USD) for his daughter’s annual tuition fee but this year half of the fee will be covered by a Government grant. However, he still needs to pay the rest of the money. The reason Enkhbold is asking for this loan is he wants to pay the rest of the annual tuition fee for his only daughter.

loans.use: To pay his daughter's annual tuition fee

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur D. lives in Yeghnik village of Aragatsotn region, Armenia.  Artur lives with his parents and 3 brothers. The family’s main income comes from agriculture: land cultivation and farming. To make extra money Artur and his brothers are also working at a local quarry. 

Artur has applied for the loan to purchase cattle. The brother’s dream is to have a sustained household economy, so they can marry and have families.

loans.use: purchasing cattle

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
The woman is shown in the picture, Yim K., lives in the Siem Reap Province. Yim K. is 58 years old and has been selling a few fresh fish in the local busy market for more than eight years. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or she buys them from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. 

Yim K. is married to Rin Voeun, 62, who works at fishing in and around the lakes of his community. This couple has seven children, four of whom are now married and have started new homes. The three remaining are single. 

Currently, the fishing is temporarily interrupted because the fishing equipment is broken. Because of this reason, Yim K. requested a loan in order to buy additional fishing tools. She proposes to use the remainder of loan to purchase a used motor.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing tools and a used motor

loans.name: Kibalinga Kyosimba Onanya A, Mubende Group

texts.en:
It has now been over eight years since the hardworking S. Joseph of Kibalinga Kyosimba Onanya Group, Mubende, started up his transport business hiring out a motorcycle (commonly referred to as “boda boda” here in Uganda) after getting help through a loan from Pearl MFI. He currently owns a motorcycle. Having a sense of dedication to his business, which he does alongside other work, has seen him earning 150,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. This is done in Kibalinga town, Mubende, where Joseph can easily get customers on a daily basis.

This loan is to help him upgrade his business and will go toward the purchase of a motorcycle. This will enable him to earn more revenue and thus be able to cover his personal bills and live a more self-sustaining life.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy S. is 28 years old. She has been operating a small rice farm with her husband since 2009. She really wants to increase her harvest so that she will be able to meet the needs of her family. She has one child who is 8 months old. She dreams that her daughter will have a better future when she grows up. 

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 4,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers. This will make her farm productive and provide a better income for her family.

She joined CEVI because it has a micro-insurance coverage for all of its clients.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more red oil.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 24 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’habillements et la restauration.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des habillements et des ingrédients pour la restauration.                                                                          
SITAN H. s’approvisionne en habits au marché de Konobougou. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement en ambulante entre les quartiers de la ville de Konobougou, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce d’habillements.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group are all married women of around 24 years old; they have three children and live in large extended families in Konobougou, the Barouéli district, in the Ségou region (the fourth largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 
They met through family links and sell clothes and food for a living. The women are on their sixth loan which will be used to purchase clothes and food ingredients. 
Sitan Haidara purchases clothes from the Konobougou market. She sells her wares every day through home sales in the different districts of Konobougou town for cash or credit; her customer base is made up of men and women.  
She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA which will be used to pay back the loan, social ceremony costs, and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
"Nelly is a 50 year old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures, a pig fattening business and operating a cafeteria. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1997 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at both her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5200.

Nelly is borrowing PHP 15000 so she can fund the operations of her 2 businesses. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19500, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Nelly aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Maria del Carmen R. R. tiene la edad de 31 años, estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria y esta casada con el señor Raul con el cual tiene 4 hijos de los cuales tres son hombres a los cuales llama Yordi de 13 años de edad  que estudia la secundaria, Raul y  Jeremi de 10 y 8  años los cuales asisten a la primaria y una mujere de nombre Jenifer de 15 años de edad que asisten a la secundaria de la comunidad de la reforma que se encuentra a 20 minutos de su comunidad. 

Doña Mary (como la llaman en su comunidad) y su familia viven en la comunidad de Vista Hermosa que se encuentra a 40 minutos de Tierra Blanca en el Veracruz, para poder llegar a la comunidad de vista hermosa se toma un autobus que te deja en la carretera y debes caminar como 25 minutos  para llegar a dicha comunidad.

 Doña Mary nos platica que hace mas de tres años inicio con su negocio de venta de tacos ya que queria  ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, ella vende los fines de semana (sabado y domingo) desde un pequeño corredor que tiene en la parte de enfrente de su casa , tambien nos platica que en temporada de calor vende frutas( sandia, piña, melon, papaya y naranjas ) casa por casa. Doña Mary nos dice que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y tambien enseñarlos a trabajar para que aprendan a ganarse la vida. Ella desea que en un futuro su negocio prospere y comprar algunas mesas y sillas para brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Doña Mary se encuentra agradecida con la fundación por la confianza que le esta brindando al otorgarle este credito el cual la ayudara a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. María del Carmen R. Rodríguez is 31 years old.  She finished sixth grade and is married to Raúl with whom she has four children.  Three are boys: Yordi, 13, who is in middle school, Raúl and Jeremi, 10 and 8, who are in elementary school, and a girl, Jenifer, 15, who goes to middle school in the community of La Reforma located 20 minutes from her community. 

Doña Mary (as she is known in her community) and her family live in the community of Vista Hermosa located 40 minutes from Tierra Blanca in Veracruz.  To get to the community of Vista Hermosa one takes a bus that drops you off on the highway and then you must walk about 25 minutes to reach the community.

Doña Mary tells us that over three years ago she started her taco selling business because she wanted to help her husband with household expenses and with her children’s educational costs.  She sells on weekends (Saturday and Sunday) from a small passageway she has in the front of her house.  She also tells us that during the hot season she sells fruit (watermelon, pineapple, papaya and oranges) house to house.  Doña Mary tells us that she wants to provide a better quality of life for her children as well as to teach them how to work so that they will learn how to earn their livelihood.  She hopes that in the future her business will prosper and to buy some tables and chairs to provide better customer service.

Doña Mary is grateful to the foundation for the trust it’s placing in her by granting this loan that will help her improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Taco sales

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna tiene 62 años, su actividad económica es la venta de madera. Hace más de 25 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza créditos Ella se siente muy motivada por continuar trabajando pues es por medio de los financiamientos que ha podido mantener activo su negocio por lo que esto hace que Reyna se sienta muy orgullosa. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo en la compra de madera y herramientas. Siempre sueña con ampliar su pequeño taller y proporcionarle a su familia una mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Reyna, 62, sells lumber.  She’s been in this business for over 25 years so this isn’t her first loan request.  

She is very motivated to keep working because through the loans she has been able to keep her business going and this makes Reyna feel very proud.

The loan will be used for working capital to buy wood and tools.  She always dreams with expanding her little workshop and provide her family with more comfort.

loans.use: To buy lumber and tools.

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en: Felistus is 23 years old and the mother of two.  She has been running a cafeteria for three years.  Previously, she was a casual laborer.  She is able to retain her customers because of her delicious and affordable meals.  She hopes to open a restaurant in the future.  In five years, she wants to build rental houses.  She has requested 50, 000 KES to buy maize and beans for preparing meals.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans

loans.name: Pâk

texts.en: Pâk S. could earn his daily income by growing rice crops on his own farmland, which comes from his grandparents years ago. He and his wife have spent most their lives farming, since they were single until the present time. Usually, they can make a profit of approximately $2 per day to use for the family’s needs. The couple is blessed with two married children. Previously, Pâk S. had rented a few carpenter laborers to build his wooden house on credit, and it is the time for paying back, but he lacks some money to pay on time. In order to deal with this situation, Pâk S. has decided to ask for a loan to pay for construction costs.

loans.use: to pay for construction costs for his home

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan tiene un hijo, empezó trabajando en una tienda como empleado, en este tiempo adquirió mucha experiencia y  esto posibilito que se anime a abrir un negocio propio, su tienda se encuentra en la zona muy concurrida de la ciudad, en un principio empezó con poco capital y a medida del tiempo  a podido capitalizarse y aumentar sus productos, con el préstamo tiene pensado el comprar más repuestos no solo de una marca sino poder diversificar las marcas y comprar repuestos originales como llantas, cilindros , retrovisores embragues. Con el tiempo tiene pensado comprar una tienda o por lo menos poder conseguir un lugar en anticrético, para poder aumentar su capital y de este modo i incrementar su capital de trabajo y el deseo del Sr. Juan es el de hacer estudiar a su hijo y que sea profesional, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan has one child. He started working as a store clerk and during that time, he acquired much experience, which created the possibility of opening his own business. With a little bit of capital, he opened a store that is now one of the busiest in the city. Over time he was able to raise more capital and increase his inventory of products.

With this loan, he wants to buy more parts of different brands. These include original parts such as tires, cylinders, clutches, and mirrors. Within time, he plans to buy a storefront or at least acquire a place through an “anticrético” rental agreement so that he can have more capital for his operations. Sr. Juan wants his son to study so that he will become a professional. He is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: To purchase vehicle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo, es un joven de 19 años de edad, se dedica al comercio de ropa, es soltero, vive en compañía de su madre y residen en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, comenzó el negocio junto a un amigo, no tiene horario de trabajo, y actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertir en el negocio.
Su inversión será en ropa, de diferentes modas y colores, para ambos sexos, esta compra le permitirá ampliar la mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes de esta manera mejorar su condición de comerciante y atender a más clientela.
Su visión es volverse mayorista en el comercio de ropa, vivir de su negocio, que este sea rentable, para obtener las ganancias necesarias para ayudar a su madre a cubrir los gastos.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a young man of 19 who sells clothes.  He is single and lives with his mother in El Transito, in San Miguel department.  He started his business with a friend.  He doesn't work fixed hours.  He is currently requesting a loan to invest in his business.

Gerardo will invest his loan in buying men's and women's clothes in different styles and colors.  This purchase will allow him to expand the merchandise he has to offer his customers.  In this way, he will improve his position as a salesman and serve more customers.

Gerardo's vision is to become a clothes wholesaler and for his business to be profitable so that he can live off it.  He would like to make the profits he needs to help his mother cover their expenses.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothes

loans.name: Con Fe Y Alegria Group

texts.es:
Elmer se dedica a la venta de tubérculos tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado de su zona ya tiene con el negocio cerca de 6 años, anteriormente  trabajó ayudando a su padre en su negocio de estructura metálica, pero debido al poco trabajo decidió dejarlo y ayudar a su mama que se dedica a la venta de verduras  poco a poco aprendió sobre el negocio, junto a su hermano deciden separarse para abrir por su propia cuenta un negocio de venta de verduras y tubérculos, así probaron durante 15 días lamentablemente su hermano se desanimo y lo dejo solo, Elmer   empezó con muy poco capital pero durante todo este tiempo ha surgido y actualmente tiene 2 camionetas con las que brinda servicio de transporte a sus colegas que traen  sus productos desde el mercado mayorista, esto lo a animado a dedicarse  a este rubro quiere comprarse otro camioncito y también anhela comprarse su propio terreno su préstamo  le servirá para seguir invirtiendo con la compra de los productos que vende como papas, cebollas, tomates etc. actualmente el ocupa el cargo de presidente del grupo “FE Y ALEGRIA” 

* Elmer esta con polo a rayas.
texts.en:
Elmer sells tubers and has a stall in his city market; he has had his business for about 6 years. Previously, Elmer worked helping his father framing metals but due to the little work he decided to leave the business and help his mother who sells vegetables. Little by little he learned about the business and with his brother they decided to open their own stalls to sell vegetables and tubers. They tried out the business for 15 days and sadly his brother got discouraged and left. Elmer started out with very little capital but at this time he has gotten ahead and at present has 2 trucks that he uses to give transportation to his colleagues who bring their products from the wholesaler market. This has encouraged him devote himself to this work and wants to buy another truck and hopes to buy his own plot of land in the future. The loan will help him to keep buying his products that he sells for example: potatoes, onions, tomatoes, etc. At present he is the president of the group “Faith and Happiness.”

*Elmer’s the one with the striped polo.

loans.use: buy tubers and vegetables.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene  34 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos menores hijos en casa de sus suegros y lamentablemente, es un caso más,  que no cuenta con servicios básicos. La vivienda de esta familia se encuentra  en la  ciudad de Tambogrande- Piura. 

El esposo de Francisca se dedica a labores de agricultura, una de las principales actividades de su distrito, con las cuales apoya a su padre. Mientras que Francisca se dedica a la ganadería, criando ovinos y cerdos, en un corral al costado de su casa.

Francisca espera que sus ovejas y cerdos tengan el tamaño y peso ideal para venderlos en el mercado local, donde los comerciantes la conocen por la buena calidad de sus animales. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles, para comprar alimentos para estos y mejorar el corral donde los cría.

Francisca es una mujer emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a su familia ayudando a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene mucha esperanza en su negocio y  bastantes deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Francisca, 34, lives with her husband and two minor children in her in-laws’ house which, sadly, is another one lacking basic utilities.  The family dwelling is located in the city of Tambogrande-Piura.

Francisca’s husband farms, one of the District’s main activities, and helps to support his father while Francisca raises sheep and pigs in a corral at the side of her house.

Francisca hopes that her sheep and pigs will reach ideal size and weight to sell them in the local market where merchants know her thanks to the good quality of her animals.  Because of this she’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy feed for them and to improve the corral she raises them in.

Francisca is an enterprising woman who wants to move her family ahead helping her husband meet household expenses.  She has much hope in her business and a strong desire for self-improvement.

loans.use: to buy feed and improve her animals' corrals.

loans.name: Oscar Humberto

texts.es:
El señor Oscar Humberto tiene 50 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 4 hijos, Oscar se dedica al negocio de transporte, posee dos trailers en el cual transporta granos basicos, cemento y hierro en todo Honduras.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de llantas para uno de sus camiones.
Su sueño es tener su propia casa para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos ya que viven en la casa de su madre.
Su pasatiempo favorito es viajar en su camion.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar Humberto is 50 years old, married, and has four children. He manages a transportation business and has two trailers that are used to transport grain, cement, and iron throughout Honduras.

His loan will be used to buy tires for one of his trucks. Oscar dreams of owning a home so that he can provide a better quality of life for his children. They currently live at his mother’s house.

His favorite hobby is traveling in his truck.

loans.use: to purchase tires for his truck.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: El señor Jorge dedicado al servicio musical ya hace mas de una década el cuenta con sus instrumentos para brindar este servicio que por cierto lo realiza muy bien ya que es un músico muy reconocido en su rubro, debido a los problemas económicos solo el y su hijo se encuentran en el país ya que su esposa se fue a trabajar al exterior. De todos modos el Sr. Jorge tiene muchas mas fuerza ya que es mucha responsabilidad de criar a su hijo solo. El crédito que solicita el cliente es para poder comprar instrumentos de ocasión para equiparse mucho mejor. Y brindar un mejor servicio musical, es una persona responsable y trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sr. Jorge makes music for a living, work that he's done for more than ten years.  He's a successful performer and he's became well known locally for his music.  Recent economic problems led his wife to leave the country to find work and he and their son live alone together.  Sr. Jorge has had to become still stronger because he now has sole responsibility for raising their child.  He's applying for a loan to buy new musical instruments so that he has the equipment he needs for his performances.  He's a responsible and hard-working man, grateful to the bank for supporting his music performance business.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments for performance business.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Rafael tiene la edad de 45 años, estudio solo la secundaria y esta casado, el tine tres hijos Zulma de 21 años y zeidy de 19 que asisten a la universidad y Rafael que asiste a primaria, el y su familia viven en el estado De Oaxaca en una comunidad llamada Tetela la cual se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una zona cañera a solo 15 minutos de uno de los ingenios azucareros llamado la margarita.

don Rafael nosplatica que hace el trabaja en el campo pero lo que gana no le alcanzaba para cubrir con los gastos del hogar asi que platicando con su esposa decidieron abrir una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes para ganar un poco de dinero extra y dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. su tienda se encuentra en un pequeño local que tiene a en su casa con vista a la calle el cual lo abre todos los dias de ocho de la mañana a  ocho de la noche, el cual atiende sus hijos y su esposa. el necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, papel de baño, sopa, azucar, sal, dulces, galletas y refrescos para resurtr su tienda. el nos platica que siempre le ha gustado tener bien surtido su negocio para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que busquen y asi vuelvan a su tienda a comprar.

don rafael espera que con este credito su negocio prospere ya que desea terminar de pagar los estudios de sus hijos y darles una mejor calidad vida
texts.en:
Rafael is 45 years old.  He only finished secondary school.  He’s married and has three children: Zulma, 21, and Zeidy, 19, who go to the university and Rafael who is in elementary school.  He and his family live in the state of Oaxaca in a community called Tetela which is noted for being located in a sugar cane growing zone just fifteen minutes form one of the large sugar cane plantations called “La Margarita.” 

Rafael tells us that he works in the fields but what he earns there wasn’t enough to cover household expenses so, talking it over with his wife, they decided to open a little grocery store to earn a little extra money and provide better quality of life for their children.  The store is located in a small locale he has at home that faces the street and that opens daily from 8am until 8pm.  His children and his wife tend to it.  He needs the loan to buy rice, beans, oil, toilet paper, soup, sugar, salt, candy, cookies and soft drinks to restock the store.  He tells us that he always likes to keep the store well stocked so that his customers always find what they are looking for and will return to shop at his store.

Rafael hopes that his business will prosper with the loan because he wants to finish paying for his children’s schooling and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Feza

texts.en:
A 33-year-old married mother of two children aged three and six years, Feza has been operating a well-organized business selling a variety of clothes for five years. Open from 7:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. every weekday, she employs one person to help her.

Feza has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more child and adult clothing to sell. With the profits arising from the loan, she plans to save for her family's future, pay school fees for her children and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase child and adult clothing to sell.

loans.name: Zarbayim

texts.en:
Zarbayim  is 21 years old. She is married and has two children. Since she has lived with her husband, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle. Her husband is master and works in construction.  She walks through the farms and several settlements to buy cattle at the lowest price to be able to increase her profits. Her monthly profit is about 60 AZN. She currently has two cows and one bull. 

Now Zarbayim wants to expand her business. As her children are grown up, she thinks that she will be able to look after more cattle with their help. She is asking for 1000 AZN in order to purchase cattle. Zarbayim expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Letty has a food shop that sells a variety of viands and green bananas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed to make food to sell.

Letty is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Letty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed to make food to sell

loans.name: Soa's Group
loans.use: to buy bamboo and materials to make more brooms.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo, de 53 años; convive hace 10 años con Felicia, con quien tiene una hija: Joselin. En su casa propia ubicada en ciudad de Tarma. Desde hace 29 años comenzó a trabajar en una empresa de trasporte público, como chofer. Trasportando a los pobladores del lugar a diferentes ciudades. En ese tiempo sufrió un accidente quedando lesionado. Ahora está tramitando su pensión por tiempo de servicio. Según menciona en este tiempo de crisis le ayuda en los gasto del hogar, su esposa. Pues se dedica a la venta de cuyes y chanchos. Los cuales enseba y vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, obteniendo una ganancia de S/. 400 soles por venta. Su principal problema son los gatos que paga mensualmente al colegio donde estudia su hija. Por ello hace poco incursionó en la fabricación de comida balanceada con el molino que posee. Elaborando harinas de quinua, maca, soya y demás productos. Cuenta que la va muy bien, pues compra sus insumos en Lima, para después moler las harinas, cuyo peso se duplica vendiendo sus productos por kilos a un mayor precio. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera concretar sus objetivos pues recibe el apoyo de todos ustedes. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Arturo de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una tonelada de maíz morocho (híbrido), cuyo costo promedio es de s/. 3 soles el kilo.
texts.en: Arturo is 53 years old and he has been married common-law with Felicia for 10 years. They have a daughter together, name Joselin. They live in a house of their own located in the city of Tarma. Twenty-nine years ago he started out working as a driver for a public transport company, transporting the public to different cities. But he has suffered an accident and he was injured. He is currently receiving a pension for his time in service. He says that during this time of crisis his wife helps him with the household expenses. She has a business selling guinea pigs and pigs. She greases them and sells them in the wholesalers market in the city, obtaining a profit of S/.400 neuvos soles per sale. His biggest problem is her daughter's monthly tuition expenses. And for this reason he recently took up producing balanced foods with the mill he has. He produces various types of flour, such as quinoa, maca, soy bean, and other products. He says that it is going very well. He buys the ingredients in Lima and he later mills them to make flour, and to duplicate the volume. He sells them by the kilogram and at a better price. He is a member of the communal bank "Senor de Muruhuay" and it is his fourth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He hopes to achieve his objectives with the support from all of you. He promises to make his loan payments on time. Arturo, on receiving your support, will invest the funds requested in the purchase of a ton of the morocho variety of corn (hybrid). The average cost is s/. 3 soles per kilogram.

loans.use: to purchase one ton of corn.

loans.name: Unidas Para Vencer Group

texts.es:
Banco Comunal Unidas para Vencer esta integrado por diez socias que se dedican a diferentes actividades economicas en la Aldea de San Nicolas en el municipio de Juticalpa. La coordinadora de este Banco se llama Kenia Jacqueline, y ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y sandalias, tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y procreo tres hijos varones.

Hace seis años atras Kenia siguiendo el ejemplo de una de sus vecinas decidio dedicarse a la venta de ropa usada, y compro su primer fardo gracias al apoyo economico de su esposo y aunque no fue mucho, eso le basto para iniciar. Su negocio no tiene nombre porque realiza las ventas de forma ambulante, y de vez en cuando en su hogar cuando sus vecinos o amistades llegan a buscarla. La dificultad mas grande que enfrenta Kenia es la temporada lluviosa porque no puede salir de su casa y pierde de vender y tambien cuando da la mercaderia al credito porque a veces se tardan mucho en cancelarle. 

El prestamo que esta solicitando Kenia lo necesita para comprar un fardo de ropa usada y tambien comprar sandalias para darle un giro diferente a su negocio. Con el apoyo de este financiamiento ella podra surtir su negocio de ropa y de sandalias de diferentes colores y estilos para satisfacer a sus clientes. 

Muy contenta Kenia expreso que con los prestamos obtenidos en FAMA a podido ir mejorando su casa y tambien pudo comprar su refrigeradora y eso le ha a ayudado a ahorrar algunos centavos porque antes se le arruinaban algunos productos que necesitaban refrigeracion.

Su meta es seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que culminen sus estudios academicos y su sueño es culminar las mejoras de su casa. Kenia tiene mas de dieciseis ciclos en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
The 'Unidas para Vencer' community bank has ten members who are engaged in different business activities in the village of San Nicolas, in Juticalpa.  The bank's coordinator is Kenia Jacqueline and she sells second-hand clothes and sandals.  She is 33 years old, married, and has three sons.

Six years ago, following the example of one of her neighbors, Kenia decided to start selling second-hand clothes and bought her first bundle of clothes with the financial support of her husband.  Although it wasn't a lot, it was enough to get her started.  Her business doesn't have a name because she makes her sales as an itinerant vendor.  She also sometimes makes sales from her home when her neighbors or friends come to find her.  The biggest difficulty that Kenia faces is the rainy season because it means she can't go out and she loses sales.  She also has problems when she sells merchandise on credit because sometimes her customers take a long time to pay her back.

Kenia needs the loan that she is requesting to buy a bundle of second-hand clothes and also to buy sandals so that she can do something a little different with her business.  With the support of this loan, she will be able to stock her business with clothes and sandales in different colors and styles in order to satisfy her customers.

Kenia commented very happily that, as a result of the loans she has received from FAMA, she has been able to continue improving her home and has also been able to buy a refrigerator.  This has helped her to save a few cents because, before she bought the refrigerator, some products that needed refrigerating used to go off.

Kenia's goal is to continue supporting her children so that they finish their education.  Her dream is to finish carrying out improvements to her home.  Kenia has been working with FAMA for more than 16 loan cycles and she has made her repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand clothes and sandals

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 61 years old and married. She had four children; one of them is working and sometimes helps her with other expenses. She patiently sells rice to the people in her neighborhood. In a sack of rice, she usually gains a profit of 500 Philippines pesos (P). 

Evangeline is now asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy more sacks of rice to sell for additional profits.

In the future, Evangeline wants to establish a stall so that she will not be selling the rice on a house-to-house basis. She is getting old so she needs to operate the business in a stall for a more comfortable way of continuously generating income for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is known as a woman of faith and courage. She is now 49 years old and has six school-aged children. Despite being a widow, she has the strong determination to educate her children and give them a better life. She endures hardships and difficulties for she wants to continue sending her children to school. 

The main sources of her income is hog-raising, managing a variety store, and direct selling of AVON, Natasha and Boardwalk products. She has been in this business for almost 26 years and usually earns a profit of P8,000 a month which she utilizes for their daily expenses and allowances for the children. 

She aims to improve her business and make it a viable source of income but due to financial constraints, she wants to ask for an additional capital of P30,000 to buy additional stock of soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, beverages, breads, seasonings, lotions, body sprays and jewelry to sell in her variety store. 

Leonida mentioned that through this loan, she can increase her product offering and satisfy her customers' needs. She hopes that in the future, she will make her business grow as she continues to work hard and strive to do well.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, beverages, breads, seasonings, lotions, body sprays and jewelry to sell in her variety store.

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is 43 years old and married with 7 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

She has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from food vending. Dulce hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maravilla 2011 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARAVILLA 2011” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Alejandra es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa usada, artesanía en títeres, venta dulces, comercio de condimentos, venta de verduras.

La señora Alejandra,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de las ferias del mercado y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Maravilla 2011” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. This group consists of six members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Alejandra, who is the president. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling used clothing, making puppets, selling candy, selling condiments, and selling vegetables.

Sra. Alejandra says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization after receiving an invitation from a local promoter. Alejandra currently has a business selling vegetables and has worked for several years. The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital so that she can buy vegetables. She acquires her inventory at the market fairs and then sells at other fairs. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Alejandra is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Alejandra said that she enjoys the savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en: Hoda is a 44-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her four children. Her husband is working outside the country and is barely helping her with the family expenses because of his limited income. That was the motive for her to start her own business working in producing handicrafts, needlework, embroidery, etc. in order to improve the family's financial situation. She has been working in this domain for the past 15 years; her work is based at her home. Additionally, she has given private lessons since 2004. Today, she’s asking to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy products for her handmade work. In the future, she plans to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy products for her handmade work.

loans.name: Sheeman's Group

texts.en:
Sheeman is a widow. She lost her husband a few years ago, leaving her to care for their five children. Now her children have grown older and they do different kinds of work to contribute to the family's finances. Sheeman remains at home and does her household tasks. She is still very active at the age of 57.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her eldest son’s business of selling betel leaves and cigarettes. With the loan he will buy betel leaves and cigarettes of different brands. This will allow him to sell more and earn better profits. He started his business two years ago. Sheeman is confident that her son will utilize the loan in a good way to earn maximum profits for his business.

Note: In the picture, the woman holding a passbook is Sheeman.

loans.use: to buy betel leaves and cigarettes to sell.

loans.name: Malkia Group

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her late 30s, is married with four children who are still going to school. She has been running a vegetable business for one year now.  She works from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she wants to use it to buy more vegetables to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Malkia," which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Kuti

texts.en:
Kuti is aged 50 years-old and has been in active farming for the last 20 years.  She also runs a retail shop in the local market with both being her sources of income for family upkeep. She is  married with three children aged 20, 17 and 11 years-old and all are schooling with the first born taking his post secondary education.

Kuti has made a request for a loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will boost her milk and enable her to buy better breeds as well as pay for education of her children.

Kuti appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan services but notes that poor state of roads in the area is a challenge to farmers when making deliveries to the market.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jerly

texts.en:
Jerly is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Jerly has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy stock from AVON to sell.

Jerly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jerly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from AVON to sell

loans.name: Gloria Libett

texts.es: Gloria originaria de León nos comparte su experiencia con su primer préstamo Kiva el cual le fue de mucha ayuda pues lo utilizo para comprar tela, hilo ,botones zipers  ya compro bastante material que necesitaba para hacer sus  pantalones, camisas, trajes de niños trajes de señora. Ha visto que su negocio ha prosperado es por ello que solicita un segundo crédito para comprar tela fina de mejor calidad. Debido a que le viene la época en que le solicitan trajes de graduación, birretes , trajes de caballero y necesita tela de muy buena calidad para satisfacer a sus clientes. Una vez cancelado su segundo crédito le gustaría adquirir una máquina de coser semi industrial para mejorar la calidad de sus diseños y hacer crecer su negocio para poder brindar oportunidad de trabajos a otras personas y de esta manera contribuir con su vecindario.
texts.en: Gloria, native of Leon, shares her experience with her first Kiva loan which was very helpful to her.  She used the loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and enough material that she needed to make pants, shirts, children's suits, and ladies suits.  She has seen that her business has prospered therefore she is asking for a second loan to buy fine quality fabric.  Since the time is approaching when she is asked for graduation gowns, caps, and men's suits she needs fine quality fabric to satisfy her customers.  After paying off her second loan she would like to buy a semi industrial sewing machine to improve the quality of her designs and expand her business to provide job opportunities to others and thus contribute to her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy fine quality fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, school uniforms, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Dolores Carlina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Divinas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dolores, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 16, 14 y 11 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en una escuela para niños especiales. Su esposo es chofer de un gerente en la ciudad de Manta.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a sus hijos y su esposo se dedica a elaborar bisutería y adornos para fiestas elaborados en fomix, estas manualidades aprendió hace muchos años y ahora elabora estos productos y los envía hasta los Estados Unidos donde tiene familiares quienes la dan vendiendo. Lleva más de 20 años dedicada a esta profesión y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar materiales útiles para elaborar sus manualidades como perlas, mullos, cadenas, broches, fomix, silicón, etc. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado en el transcurso de este tiempo.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
In the residential area La California in Portoviejo, capital of Manabí which has been known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees, the members of the communal bank Las Divinas meet every fifteen days. 

Here we meet Dolores. She is 42 years old and married, and she and her husband have 3 children aged 16, 14, and 11 years old. The two oldest study in high school, and the youngest in a school especially for children. Her husband is a chauffeur for a businessman in the city of Manta. 

In order to earn something of her own and to help her children and her spouse, she works decorating jewelry and ornaments with craft foam for parties. She learned this craft many years ago, and now  she makes those products and sends them to the United States where she has family members who sell them. She’s been doing this work for over 20 years, and it’s going very well. 

This loan is to buy materials used to make her crafts like pearls, beads, chains, broaches, craft foam, silicon, etc. She’s been with the communal bank for 5 years, and she like the help they’ve given her during this time. 

Her dreams are to keep advancing her business and that her children don’t lack anything.

loans.use: to buy pearls, beads, chains, broaches, craft foam, silicon, etc.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells spare parts. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are good. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the 99,000 Kenya Shilling (KES) loan to buy more stock of spare parts. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spare parts

loans.name: Portocal

texts.en:
P. P. (literally translated, Orange Orange) is one of the leaders of the community in the Sliven Roma ghetto. His wife began operating a small food pantry 10 years ago while P. drove a taxi in the center of Sliven to generate the capital needed to support the business while it started. 6 years ago, he and his wife moved to a larger location and now continue to operate the small neighborhood grocery store. Now, the one-room store is big enough to employ P., his wife and two daughters, both in their 20s, and support their four children. P. has taken 8 bank loans to expand his business over the years, and has proudly repaid each one fully and on time. He is excited about the Kiva program, however, because it permits him to borrow money for dramatically less than he had been paying.

P. is a role model within his community, as his business is one of the very few that has been successful over time. He is known for his honesty and compassion, extending credit to families that would otherwise go hungry between paydays. With this loan he plans to increase his inventory and provide a working capital cushion.

The Roma, commonly known as gypsies, is a severely marginalized social group in Bulgaria and throughout the Balkans.

loans.use: Working capital (inventory)

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur H. is an Internally-Displaced Person (IDP) from the Lachin region of Azerbaijan. He fled to Agsu 13 years ago. He is married with two children. For the past three years he has owned a small booth at the local bazaar where he sells men's and women's clothing. With this loan he wants to increase his current inventory and improve his business.

loans.use: to improve his business

loans.name: Fofoga

texts.en:
Fofoga has a family of five. She operates her business from her home, selling popcorn. Her business is popular with village members, especially the younger people. She makes 50 packets of popcorn a day, and sells them for one tala a packet.

Fofoga does this six days a week, while her husband helps earn more money as a taxi driver.

She needs 1,250 to purchase more corn seeds and oven to expand her business and buy gas.

loans.use: To purchase corn seeds, oven, and gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Selenia Yamileth

texts.en:
